div0.head: *y
div0.entryFree:
*y y, yei= (q. v.), to/, indecl., twenty-third letter of the Ionic alphabet, Pl.Cra.427a, Callias ap.Ath.10.453d: not used in the Attic alphabet: in the Western Gr. alphabets it represents the sound x (
kh): with the value
ps it is found in SIG1 (Nubia, vi B. C.), etc.: as a numberal, y/ = 700, but y' = 700,000.
y y repeated, as exclamation, S.Ichn.170.

ya/gda_n, a_nos, or sa/gdas, o(, an Egyptian
unguent; the following forms are found: *ai)gupti/w| ya/gdani tri\s leloume/nh Eub.102; fe/r' i)/dw, ti/ soi dw= tw=n mu/rwn; ya/gdan filei=s; Ar.Fr.206; sa/gdan e)rugga/nonta Eup.198; ba/kkari/s te kai\ sa/gdas o(mou= Epil.1: ya/da| (sic codd.) is cited by Erot. fr. Hp. (not found in codd. Hp.), and fr. Eup. (Fr.198?): nom. yagdhs (unaccented) Ath.15.690e, cf. yagdh=s, Hsch. (Egypt.
sgnn with or without prefixed masc. Art.
p;).

ya/gios [a^], a, on,
oblique, askew, metaph.,
mal Ã propos, blundering, ei) pa\r me/los e)/rxomai ya/gion (sic codd. vett.) o)/aron e)nne/pwn Pi.N.7.69: ya/gion: pla/gion, loco/n, e)pikeklime/non, Hsch.; ya/dion: ka/tantes, Id.
ya/dda: h( kina/baris, Id. yaduro/s, v. yaquro/s.
yae/nai: fqa/sai, kti/sai, Id.

ya^qa/llw,
scratch, rub, su\ de\ th\n kefalh\n ya/qalle/ mou
scratch my head, Hermipp.78, cf. Pl.Com.59.
yaqaro/s, v. yaquro/s.
ya/qea: ywmi/a, Hsch. (yaqe/a cod.).
ya^qoplo/kos, o(, = yiaqoplo/kos, Sammelb.5124.332 (ii A. D.).
ya^qu/rion [u^], to/, = yw/qion, Ath.14.646c.

ya^qu^ro/omai, Pass.,
crumble away, Aq.Jo.9.5(11), Ps.101(102).4.

ya^qu^ro/s, o/n,
friable, crumbling, of the roe in fish, Arist.HA510b26; i)xqu=s . . tou\s sarkw/deis kai\ y. Diocl.Fr.141; opp. gli/sxros, Arist. Mete.387a15; of bread, Gal.6.523; of cheese, opp. kollw/dhs, ib.698 (Comp.); of meat, Ruf. ap. Orib.4.2.8 (Comp.); to\ u(/dwr y. Arist. Sens.441a25; of air, Id.de An.419b35; of earth, Thphr.CP2.4.11, Nic.Al.145; gh= -wte/ra Gp.3.3.10; of the texture of some bulbs, Thphr.HP7.9.4; of leaves in a salad, Hp.Liqu.5 (Comp.); also yaduro/n: a)sqene/s, madaro/n, yaquro/n, Hsch. (the form is Att. acc. to Gal.16.760), and yaqara/: eu)/qlasta, etc., Hsch.; cf. yafaro/s.

ya^qu^ro/ths, htos, h(,
looseness of consistency, Arist.HA524b26, Pr. 928a10, Gal.6.799.

yaidra/: a)raio/trixa, Hsch.: yaidro/n: faidro/n, . . , Id. (Cypr. acc. to Et.Gud.572.53). yaiqo/n: u(pofoini/sson, Hsch. yaika/zei: r(a<i/>nei, Id. (yak- poscit ordo). yai/kalon: e)/mbruon, bre/fos, Id. (leg. yak-).
yaikalou=xon: e)/mbruon, Id. yai=ma: o)li/gon Id.; cf. yai=sma.
yainou/zein: dia\ r(.pismou= katayu/xein. ga\r de\ kai\ drapismou=, Id. (Fort. yainuqi/zein: dia\ r(ipismou= k., grï¼a/fetaiï¼ de\ kai\ dia\ prismou= katayh/xein.ï¼

yainu/qios, on,
false, vain, Hsch.:âLyc.1420 has yai/nunqa qespi/zein prophesy
falsely (formed like mi/nunqa).
yainu=ntes: ywmi/zontes, Hsch. yai/nuon: a)xrei=on, Id. yainu/roito: diesei/sato, Id. yai/nusma: o)li/gon, Id.; cf. yai=sma.
yainu/ssein: r(<i>pi/zein, Id.

yai/rw, only pres., and not in Att. Prose: (v. ya/w): trans.,
graze, brush lightly, touch gently, oi)=mon ai)qe/ros yai/rei pteroi=s . . oi)wno/s
is ready to skim the path of ether, A.Pr.396;
rub, scrape gently in washing, Eun.VSp.486B. intr.,
move lightly or
quiver, flutter, palpitate, of an irregular pulse and the like , Hp.Mul.2.120: hence,
rustle, murmur, of the
rustling of leaves in the breeze, Luc. Trag.315; of stars,
twinkle, Nic.Th.123. yai/rein le/gomen to\ i(sti/on o(/tan e)lafrw=s diapne/htai Hsch. s.v. diayai/rousi.
yai=sma: si=ton o)li/gon, Hsch., cf. yai=ma, yai/nusma.
yaist-i/on, Dim. of yaisto/n, AP5.16 (Gaet.), dub. in IG5(1).1447 (Messene, iii/ii B. C.).

yaist-o/s, h/, o/n, (yai/w)
ground, y. ma=za a cake
of ground barley mixed with honey and oil, Hp.Int.20; yaisto/n, to/ (sc. pe/mma or po/panon), a
cake of this kind, used at sacrifices, Ar.Pl. 138, 1115, Antiph.206.3, Com.Adesp.372, Thphr. ap. Porph.Abst.2.15, SIG1038.18(Eleusis, iv/iii B. C.), Herod.4.92, AP6.190 (Gaet.), 191 (Corn. Long.): perh. to be written ya|sto/s, cf. ya=|ston: su\n tw=| i_, e)ktei/nousi to\ a_, w(s *eu)fro/nios, Lex.Mess.p.411: v. yasth/s.

yaist-w/dhs, es,
like a yaisto/n, AB313.

yai/stwr, oros, o(,
one that wipes off, spo/ggos AP6.295 (Phan.).

yai/w, = ya/w (q. v.),
rub away, grind down, in aor. 1 Med., Thphr. ap.Porph.Abst.2.6:âaor. Pass., ibid.

ya^ka/dion, later yeka/dion, to/, Dim. of yaka/s,
drizzle, Polioch.2.5, Thphr.CP2.9.3.

ya^ka/d-issa [a^d], h(,
spotted, dappled, of a mare, prob. in PPetr. 2p.115 (ii B. C.).

ya^kad-isxi/ois (dat. pl.),
with dappled haunches(?), of horses, ibid.

ya^ka/zw, later yeka/zw, (yaka/s):â
rain in small drops, drizzle, drip, Ar.Nu.580: impers., yaka/zei
it drizzles, yakaze/tw a)/rtoisi
let it rain loaves, Nicoph.13:âMed., ei)ka/zousi . . lu/xnw| yakazome/nw| mu/wpa they like n a short-sighted person to a
spluttering (i. e. dying) lamp, prob. in Arist.Rh.1413a4 (cf. Anon.in Rh.217.3; ei)s mu/wpa codd., ei)s secl. Buhle):âPass., yekasqe/nta
moistened with slight rain, Thphr.CP6.19.5.

ya/ka^lon [a^], to/,
new-born animal, Ar.Byz. ap. Eust.1625.48; ya/kalos, o(, Id. ap. Ael.NA7.47: yai/kalon in cod. Hsch. (From yaka/s; for the sense cf. dro/sos, e(/rsh.ï¼

ya^ka^lou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
having young, mhte/res y. mothers
with their young, S.Fr.793 (anap.); cf. yaikalou=xon.

ya^ka/s, Ion. and later (cf. Moer.p.419 P.) yeka/s, a/dos, h(:â
drop of rain, o(/tan me\n kata\ mikra\ fe/rhtai, yaka/des, o(/tan de\ kata\ mei/zw mo/ria, u(eto\s kalei=tai Arist.Mete.347a11, cf. 348a7, al.;
particle, ib.373b16: mostly collect.,
drizzle, yaka\s de\ lh/gei, i. e. heavy rain (o)/mbros) is coming, A.Ag.1534 (lyr.); opp. u(etoi/, X.Cyn.5.4 (pl.); u(/sqhsan ai( *qh=bai yaka/di Hdt.3.10: generally,
rain, u(po\ ste/gh| puknh=s a)kou=sai yaka/dos S.Fr.636, cf. E.Hel.2, Ar.Th.856; so yeka/s Hp.Epid.2.3.1: yeka/des
showers, Gal.17(1).37; also foi/nissa yaka/s
a shower of blood, Simon.106; ba/llei m' e)remnh=| yaka/di foini/as dro/sou A.Ag.1390; *bromi/ou yaka/dessi, i. e.
drops of wine, Critias 1.10. Comic name for
a sputterer, Ar.Ach.1150 (lyr.), cf. Suid. s.v. metaph. of solids, a)rguri/ou mhde\ yaka/s not a
drop of money, Ar.Pax121; [ya/mmou] yeka/s
grains of sand, AP12.145. (yaka/s prob. by assimilation from yeka/s.ï¼

ya^kasto/s, h/, o/n,
dripping, mu/ron Ephipp.26.
ya/kelon: me/ga, Hsch. (cod. me/sa), Suid.

ya/kion [a^], to/, Dim. of yaka/s,
small piece or
drop, Hsch. ya/kta, h(, a kind of
cake, Id. yakth/r, h=ros, o(, = yh/ktra, Id. (perh. for *yhkth/r).
yala/qrion, dub. l. in AP7.472.11 (Leon.).
ya^la/kanqa [a^k], h(, name of a fabulous plant, Eub.28 (hex.), Ptol. Heph. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.150B. (Ptol.Cyther., Suid.).
yala/kios, o(, perh. an occupational name, dub. in PLond.3.604.40(i A. D.).

ya^lakto/s, h/, o/n,
to be touched, dub. in Hsch.; cf. a)ya/laktos.

ya^la/ssw, later Att. ya^ka/d-ttw, like ya/llw, yaqa/llw,
touch lightly, Ael.NA3.18; y. ktu/pon neura=s make a string sound
by touching it, Lyc.139:âaor. 1 Med. in Hsch.

ya^li/dion [i^d], to/,
pair of scissors, POxy.1289.5,6 (v A. D.). as pr. name,
Scissors, nickname of Alexander Logotheta, because he
clipped the coins, Procop.Arc.26, Goth.3.1.

ya^li^do-eidh/s, e/s, (yali/s 11)
like a vault or
arch, Ph.Bel.81.35, Gal.UP8.11.

ya^li^do/-stomos, on,
nipper-mouthed, Com. epith. of crabs, Batr.295.

ya^li^d-o/w, (yali/s 11)
vault, arch, Bito 54.7 (Pass.).

ya^li^/d-wma, atos, to/,
vault, CIG4385 (Isauria, ii A. D.); y. kamarwta/ Str.16.1.5, cf. Gloss.

ya^li^d-wto/s, h/, o/n,
arched, vaulted, i(ppafe/seis D.H.3.68.

ya^l-i/zw, fut. -i/cw Anacreont.9.4: (yali/s):â
clip with scissors, l. c., Archig. ap. Orib.8.2.10, Antyll. ap. eund.7.21.6; to\n mallo\n e)ya/lizen Babr.51.4, cf. Aesop.382b: yali/cai: kei=rai, Hsch.

ya^/l-ion, to/, part of the bridle,
curb-chain, r(utagwge/a . . e)k tou= y. h)rthme/non X.Eq. 7.1; to\ peri\ ge/neion dieiro/menon, ya/lion Poll.1.148; = kri/kos tou= xalinou=, Sch.E.Ph.792: freq. in pl., because
the curb-chain was formed of links, which rattled as the horse moved, xrusoxa/linon pa/tagon yali/wn Ar.Pax155 (anap.); yali/wn kro/ton kai\ xalinou= ktu/pon Ael. NA6.10; yali/ois e)da/mase pw/lous E.HF381 (lyr.): metaph., oi(=on y. au)th=| [th=| basilei/a|] e)ne/bale th\n tw=n *)efo/rwn du/namin Pl.Lg.692a. generally,
chain, bond, A.Pr.54 (pl.): metaph., me/ga d' a)fh|re/qh y. oi)ketw=n Id.Ch.962 (lyr.). borinou= kai\ notinou= yali/ou (or *yali/ou) the N. and S.
ring (or Ring), in description of an estate, POxy. 1632.12 (iv A. D.). a horse's
jaw, Hippiatr.28 (cf. ye/lion, ya/llion).

ya^l-i/s, i/dos, h(,
a pair of scissors, among the toilette articles of a lady, Ar.Fr.320.1, S.Fr.413 (nisi leg. ye/lia), PTeb.331.13 (ii A. D.); drepa/noisi kai\ ou) yali/dessi karh=nai AP11.368 (Jul.Antecessor).
razor, expld. by mia=| maxai/ra| (v. ma/xaira), Poll.2.32, 10.140.
sewer, drain, stenh\n d' e)/dumen yali/da S.Fr.367;
vault, crypt, yali/dapromh/kh li/qwn poti/mwn Pl.Lg.947d;
barrel-vault, Supp.Epigr.2.582 (Ionia, iii/ii B. C.),
Explor.Arch. de DÃ©los 11.262, Ph.Bel.80.46 (pl.), Hero
*Stereom.2.28; a)nh/geiren th\ny. tau/thn Supp.Epigr.2.755 (Syria, ii A. D.); Gal. compares the
fornix (yalidoeide/s) of the brain to a y. oi)kodomh/matos sfairoeidou=s, 2.725; similarly the
arch of the foot, UP 3.8; having keystones (o)mfaloi/), Arist.Mu.399b30; and being curved (kamfqei=sa), Str.17.1.42 (dub.), D.S.2.9; expld. by kama/ra and a(yi/s, Sch.Pl. l. c., Suid.; as entrance and exit of a theatre, LW1586 (Aphrodisias, written yeli/s). ai( y. tw=n stu/lwn prob. the
rounded mouldings between the capital and the column, LXX Ex.27.10, 11; so perh. yalli/des in BGU1028.9 (ii A. D.). pl.,
rings for the staves of the altar of incense, LXX Ex.30.4;
iron bands for strengthening an engine, Ph.Bel.57.33. = taxei=a ki/nhsis, Sch.Pl.Lg.947d.

ya^l-ismo/s, o(,
clipping, Archig. ap. Orib.8.2.
5.

ya^l-iste/on,
one must clip, Antyll. ap. Orib.45.24.10.

ya^l-isto/s, h/, o/n,
clipped, Hierocl.p.54A., Antyll. ap. Orib.8.5.1, AÃ«t.3.129.

yallhgenh/s, e/s, (ya/llw)
sprung from harp-playing, Com. epith. of Archytas, strictly a parody of Homer's moirhgenh/s, Bion ap. D.L.4.52.

ya/llion, to/, = ya/lion, prob.
chain, PLond.3.1177.234 (ii A. D.).
yalli/s, v. yali/s 111.

ya/llw, fut. ya^lw= LXX Jd.5.3, 1 Ep.Cor.14.15: aor. e)/yhla Pl.Ly. 209b, etc., and in LXX e)/ya_la Ps.9.12, al.:â
pluck, pull, twitch, y. e)/qeiran
pluck the hair, A.Pers.1062: esp. of the bow-string, to/cwn xeri\ ya/llousi neura/s
twang them, E.Ba.784; keno\n kro/ton Lyc.1453; e)k ke/raos y. be/los
send a shaft
twanging from the bow, APl.4.211 (Stat. Flacc.); so miltoxarh\s sxoi=nos yallome/nh a carpenter's red line, which
is twitched and then suddenly let go, so as to leave a mark, AP6.103 (Phil.): metaph., gunai=kas e)c a)ndrw=n yo/gos ya/llei, keno\n to/ceuma E.Fr.499. mostly of the strings of musical instruments,
play a stringed instrument
with the fingers, and not with the plectron, yh=lai kai\ krou/ein tw=| plh/ktrw| Pl. l. c., et ibi Sch.; e)a/n tis yh/las th\n nh/thn e)pila/bh| Arist.Pr.919b15; mousikw/tatos w)\n xata\ xei=ra di/xa plh/ktrou e)/yalle Ath.4.183d; opp. kiqari/zw, Hdt.1.155, SIG578.18 (Teos, ii B. C.); pri\n me/n s' e(pta/tonon ya/llon (sc. th\n lu/ran) Ion Eleg.3.3: abs., Hdt. l. c., Ar.Eq.522, Hippias (?) in PHib.1.13.24; ko/rais Men.Epit.260; ya/llein [ou)k e)/ni] a)/neu lu/ras Luc.Par.17:âProv., r(a=|on h)/ tis a)\n xordh\n yh/leie 'as easy as falling off a log', Aristid.Or.26(14).31. later,
sing to a harp, LXX Ps.7.18, 9.12, al.; th=| kardi/a| Ep.Eph.5.19; tw=| pneu/mati 1 Ep.Cor. l. c. Pass., of the instrument,
to be struck or
played, yallome/nh xordh/ Arist.Pr.919b2; also of persons,
to be played to on the harp, Macho ap.Ath.8.348f.

ya/l-ma, atos, to/,
tune played on a stringed instrument, AP11.34 (Phld.), Max.Tyr.37.4.

yal-mi/zw,
sing psalms, and yal-misth/s, ou=, o(,
psalmist, Gloss.

yal-mo/s, o(,
twitching or
twanging with the fingers, yalmoi\ to/cwn E.Ion173 (lyr.); toch/rei yalmw=| [toceu/sas] Id.HF1064 (lyr.). mostly of musical strings, phkti/dwn yalmoi=s kre/kon u(/mnon Telest.5, cf. Diog.Trag.1.9, Aret.CA1.1.
the sound of the cithara or
harp, Pi.Fr.125, cf. Phryn.Trag.11; yalmo\s d' a)lala/zei A.Fr.57.7 (anap.); there were contests in to\ ya/llein, Michel898.10(Chios, ii B. C.), 913.6(Teos, ii B. C.). later,
song sung to the harp, psalm, LXX 2 Ki.23.1, al., Ep.Eph.5.19; bi/blos yalmw=n Ev.Luc.20.42.

yalmoxa^rh/s, e/s,
delighting in harp-playing, of Apollo, AP9.525.24.

yalmw|d-i/a,
singing to the harp, Aristid.2.310J.

yalmw|d-o/s, o(,
psalmist, LXX Si.47.9 cod.Sin., 50.18.
ya/l-sis, ews, h(, = yalmo/s, Philostr.VA6.10.

yal-th/rion, to/,
stringed instrument, psaltery, harp, tri/gwna y. Arist.Pr.919b12, cf. Hippias(?) in PHib.1.13.31, Apollod. ap. Ath.14.636f, Thphr.HP5.7.6, LXX Ge.4.21, al., Jul.Or.2.49c.

ya/l-ths, ou, o(,
harper, Men.495, Hippias (?) in PHib.1.13.7, 25, Macho ap.Ath.8.348f, LXX 1 Es.5.42, Plu.2.67f, 223f, cf. kiqaristh\s h)\ y. SIG578.15 (Teos, ii B. C.); epith. of Apollo, AP9.525.24. [Oxyt. in Att., parox. in Hellenistic Gr., Choerob. in Theod.1.187H.]
ya/l-tigc, iggos, h(, = kiqa/ra, Hsch., Suid.

yal-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for harp playing, y. o)/rganon a
stringed instrument, Ath.14.634f (of the ma/gadisï¼; a)/ndra yaltikh\n a)gaqo/n a good
harpist, Ael. ap. Ar.Byz.Epit.84.8.

yal-to/s, h/, o/n,
sung to the harp, sung of, LXX Ps.118(119).54.

ya/l-tria, h(,
female harper, Pl.Prt. 347d, Ion Trag.22, Arist.Ath.50.2, Men.319.4, Plu.Caes.10, al.

yaltw|d-e/w,
sing to the harp, LXX 2 Ch.5.13.
yaltw|d-o/s, o/n, = yalmw|do/s, ib.1 Ch.9.33, 2 Ch.5.12, al., v.l. ib.Si.47.9.
yalu/gwn: e)/nioi ya/lugas ta\s legome/nas yuxa/s, a)/meinon. kai\ tou\s a)sqenei=s spinqh=ras, Hsch. (cf. feya/luc).

ya^ma^q-hi/+s, i/dos, h(,
sandy, Nic.Th.887.

ya^ma^q-i/a, h(,
sandy seashore, Hsch.
ya^ma^q-i/s, i=dos, h(, a sea-fish, elsewh. u(=s, Numen. ap. Ath. 7.327a.

ya^/ma^q-os, h( (poet., also in a Homeric paraphrase, Plu.2.393e),
sand of the sea-shore, e)/reipe de\ tei=xos *)axaiw=n . . , w(s o(/te tis ya/maqon pa/i+s a)/gxi qala/sshs . . sune/xeue Il.15.362; yama/qw| ei)lume/na pollh=| Od. 14.136; a)mfi\ xlwra\n y. S.Aj.1064; parakti/a y. E.IA165 (lyr.), cf. 1054 (lyr.); para\ y. kai\ qi=n' a(lo/s Ar.V.1520 (lyr.): freq. in pl., nh=a . . e)p' h)pei/roio e)/russan u(you= e)pi\ yama/qois Il.1.486; e)pi\ yama/qois a(li/h|si Od.3.38, cf. 4.438; of
river-sand, Il.21.202, 319. prov. of a countless multitude, o(/sa y. te ko/nis te ib.9.385: pl.,
grains of sand, fu/lloisin e)oiko/tes h)\ yama/qoisin 2.800; o(po/sai e)n qala/ssa| kai\ potamoi=s ya/maqoi klone/ontai Pi.P.9.47. (Perh. formed by combining ya/mmos and a)/maqos; similarly a)/mmos ï¼a(/mmos) by combining a)/maqos and ya/mmos; a)/maqos is cogn. with Engl.
sand.ï¼

ya^ma^q-w/dhs, es,
sandy, xw=ros h.Merc. 75, al., cf. A.R.4.1376, etc.
ya/mma, atos, to/, in pl. ya/mmata: spara/gmata, Hsch.

yammai=os, a, on,
sandy, Inscr.Prien.326.2.

yamma^ko/sioi, ai, a,
sand-hundred, Com. word formed from ya/mmos after the analogy of diako/sioi, triako/sioi, etc., to denote a countless multitude, y. qeatai/ Eup.286 (yammok- v. l. ap.Suid.), cf. Ath. 15.671a; also o)no/mata y.
grandiloquent terms, Id.6.230d.âSo the exaggerated form yamma^kosioga/rga^roi, ai, a, Ar.Ach.3 (v.l. yammok-): cf. ga/rgara.
yamma^ti/zw, = ywmi/zw, Hsch.
ya/mmh, h(, rarer form of ya/mmos, Hdt.4.181 (v.l. ya/mmos), who elsewh. always has the common form: Dor. ya/mma A.Pr.573 (lyr.), Ar.Lys.1261 (lyr.).

ya/mmhton, to/, a kind of
cake, Harp. s.v. *(eka/ths nh=sos.

yamm-iai=os, a, on,
of the size of a grain of sand, me/geqos Olymp. in Phd.p.31 N.
yamm-i/as a)ka/ta corrupt in A.Ag.985 (lyr.).

ya/mm-i^nos, h, on,
of sand, sandy, Hdt.2.99, Philostr.Her.3.4.

yamm-i/on, to/, Dim.,
grain of sand: in pl., of
gravel in urine, Ruf.Ren.Ves.3.6, 11, Aret.SD2.3, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.110.

yamm-ismo/s, o(,
burying in sand, Paul.Aeg.3.78.19(pl.).

yamm-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
from sand, do/rpos AP9.551 (Antiphil.). (sc. a)riqmo/s) name of a treatise (Arenarius) by Archimedes. u(=s

yammo/-gews, wn,
with a sandy soil, Hdn.Epim.208.

yammo-du/ths [u^], ou, o(, like a)mmodu/ths,
sand-diver; name of
a fish that buries itself in the sand, elsewh. kalliw/numos, Hsch. name for a

yeudepe/w, = yeudoepe/w, yeudologe/w, Hsch.

yeudepi/-gra^fos, on,

yeudepi-eikh/s, e/s,

yeudepixa/rmeios, on,

yeude/fodos, h(,

yeudhgor-e/w,

PMag. Leid.V. 10.8.

yeudhgor-i/a, h(,

speaking falsely, lying, Lyc.1455.
yeudhloge/w, = yeudologe/w, dub. in Luc.Ocyp.63:âyeudhlo/gos, on, = yeudolo/gos, gloss on yeudhgo/ros, Lex. in An.Bachm.1.419, v.l. in Suid. s.v. yeudhgo/ros.

yeudh/rion, to/, = kenh/rion,
cenotaph, Lyc.1048,1181.

yeudh/s, e/s (the neut. sg. yeude/s is not found in early writers, yeu=dos being used instead, cf. yeu=dos 111; it is found in later Gr., OGI669.54 (Egypt, i A.D.), Palaeph.6, al., Gal.18(2).782); gen. sg. yeudou=s Id.15.168; old Att. acc. pl. yeuda=s IG12.700: (yeu/domai):â
lying, false, untrue, of things, opp. a)lhqh/s, y. lo/goi Hes.Th.229; mu=qoi A.Pr.685, E.Hipp.1288 (anap.); tre/pesqai e)pi\ yeude/a o(do/n to betake oneself to
falsehood, Hdt.1.117; y. kathgori/a, ai)ti/ai,
false charges, Aeschin.2.183, Isoc. 15.138, Plb.5.41.3; lo/goi S.OT526; lo/gos Pl.Sph.240e, Cra.385b: y. lo/goi are also
fallacies, in Logic, Arist.Top.162b3 sqq.; h(/de h( y. ou)si/a this
unreal Being (sc. the world of sense), Plot.5.8.9: irreg. Sup. yeudi/statos, ei)/dh Ael.VH14.37. of persons,
lying, false, and as Subst.,
liar, ou) ga\r e)pi\ yeude/ssi path\r *zeu\s e)/sset' a)rwgo/s Il.4.235 (only here in Hom.; perh. yeu/dessi from yeu=dos is the true accent; so Hermappias ap.Hdn.Gr.2.45 against Aristarch. and Ptol.Asc. ibid.); tou\s qeou\s yeudei=s ti/qhs S. Ph.992, cf. Ant.657; y. e)/fus E.Or.1608; y. fanh/sesqai to be detected
in falsehood, Th.4.27, cf. Pl.Tht.148b; *kriti/an yeudh= e)pidei/cw Id.Chrm.158d: irreg. Sup. yeudi/statos
arrant liar, EM 110.29, cf. Eust.1441.25. ta\ yeudh=
falsehoods, lies, ou) yeudh= le/gw A.Ag.625, cf. Antipho 1.10, etc.; ou)k e)/sq' o(/pws le/caimi ta\ yeudh= kala/ A.Ag.620; tina\s y. diaba/llein Ar.Eq.64; yeudw=n sugkollhth/s Id.Nu.446 (anap.). yeude/wn a)gorh/, in Hp.Epid.3.1. h/, ib/, said to be a name of
the monkey-market, perhaps as being
villanous counterfeits of humanity. Pass.,
beguiled, deceived, E.IA852. Adv. yeudw=s
falsely, le/gein Id.IT1309 codd.; prospoih/sasqai Th.1.137;
mistakenly, y. doca/zein Pl.Phlb. 40d; y. gene/sqai to\n fo/bon
groundlessly, Plb.5.110.7.

yeudhsio/deios, on,
falsely ascribed to Hesiod, Cic.Att.7.18.4.

yeudi^ereu/s, e/ws, o(,
false priest, J.AJ9.6.6, al.
yeu=dis, ios, o(, h(, poet. word, = yeudh/s, Pi.N.7.49.

yeudi^so/domos, on,

yeudo-boh/qeia, h(,

yeudo-bou/nion, to/,

yeudo-gauro/omai,

yeudo-glwtte/w, = yeudologe/w, Phryn.PSp.127B.

yeudogra^f-e/w, Geom.,
give a fallacious proof, Arist.Top.101a10:âPass., ib. 132a33, 160b36.
write false accounts or
statements, PEnteux.63.18(iii B.C.), Plb.12.7.6, 16.14.8, PTeb.78.17 (ii B.C.).

yeudogra^/f-hma, atos, to/,
false diagram, fallacious proof, Arist.SE 171b12 (pl.), Alex.Aphr. in Top.22.20, in SE76.23.

yeudogra^f-i/a, h(, = foreg., in pl., Ps.-Archyt. ap. Stob.1.41.5, Quint.Inst.1.10.39.
false account, Ath.5.216b.

yeudo/gra^f-os (parox.), o(,
a drawer of false diagrams, Arist.SE171b35, al.
writer of falsehoods, Thom.Mag. p.224 R.: =
falsarius, Gloss.

yeudo/-deipnon, to/,
false, unreal repast, A.Fr.258 (pl.).

yeudo-dialektiko/s, h/, o/n,
pretending to skill in dialectics, Gal.8.629.

yeudo-di^da/ska^los, o(,
false teacher, 2 EP.Petr.2.1.

entryFree.sense:
qu/rai

yeudo-di/ktamnon, to/,
false dittany, Ballota acetabulosa, Hp.Nat.Mul.32, Thphr.HP9.16.2, Dsc.3.32.

yeudodoc-e/w,

notion, Epicur.Fr.253, Plb.10.2.3, 16.12.11, Phld.Ir.p.76W., Ph.1.363, J.AJ9.4.3.

yeudodoc-i/a, h(,
false opinion or
notion, Polystr.p.14 W., Phld.D.1.14(pl.), Str.14.5.28, Plu.2.716b, Hierocl. in CA12p.446M., etc.

yeudo/doc-os, on,
holding a false opinion or
notion, labouring under a delusion, Gal.19.484.
yeudo-ene/dra, h(, = yeudene/dra, Polyaen.3.9.32.

yeudo-epe/w,
speak falsely, Jul.Gal.351c.

yeudo-qu^ri/s, i/dos, h(,

yeudo/-qu^ron, to/,

secret) door, Cic.Verr.2.2.20, al., Gloss.

yeudo-i+store/w,
narrate falsely, Eust.363.28.
yeudo-ka/rpa^sos, o(, = ka/xru, Ps.-Dsc.3.74.

yeudo-kassi/a, h(,

Cat. Cod.Astr.8(2).94).

yeudo-kh=ruc, u_kos, o(,
false, lying herald, S.Ph.1306.

yeudo-kinna/mwmon [a^], to/,

yeudoklht-ei/a, h(, (klhteu/w)
the offence of falsely subscribing one's name as witness to a summons (klhth/rï¼, grafh\ yeudoklhtei/as a prosecution
for such false subscription, D.53.17, Arist.Ath.59.3; badi/zein e)pi/ tina th=s yeudoklhtei/as D.53.15; yeudoklhtei/as tri\s o)flei=n And. 1.74.âThis is the form found in Arist. l.c. (Pap.), in the best codd. of D. and in Poll.8.40, 44; yeudoklhti/a is found in codd. of And. and as v. l. in D.; yeudoklhsi/a in Harp. (with vv.ll. -klhti/a, -klhsti/a, -klhsis), Suid.

yeudoklht-h/r, h=ros, o(,
one who falsely subscribes his name as witness to a summons, Theopomp.Hist.267.
yeudo-kora, dub. (perh. incomplete) in Ostr.Bodl.iii 295 (i A.D.).

yeudo-ko/rh, h(,
a pretended maid, Poll.4.151.

yeudo-lh/rhma, atos, to/,

yeudo-lh|sth/s, ou=, o(,

yeudolo/g-hma, atos, to/,

yeudolog-i/a, h(,
falsehood, Isoc. 12.1, D.35.32, etc.: pl., Isoc.12.78, Thphr.Char.8.15.

yeudolog-iko/s, h/, o/n,
lying, false, Proll.Hermog. in
Prolegomenon Sylloge p.282 Rabe.
yeudolog-isth/s, ou=, o(, = sq., name of a treatise by Lucian.

yeudo/log-os (parox.), on,
speaking falsely, lying, Ar.Ra.1521 (anap.); o( y. Plb. 31.22.9, cf. Phld.Po.5.14, Gal.Anim.Pass.2.2, etc.; sofi/hs AP 9.80 (Leon.).
yeu/domai, v. yeu/dw B.

yeudo/mantis, ews, o(, h(,
false prophet, Hdt.4.69, A.Ag.1195, S.OC 1097, E.Or.1667, etc.

yeudoma/rios [a^],

yeudoma/rtu^r-a, ta/, = yeudomartu/ria, IG5(2).357.5,6(Stymphalus, iii B.C.).

yeudomartu^r-e/w,
to be a false witness, bear false witness, Critias 61, Pl.R.575b, X.Mem.4.4.11, Arist.Rh.1375a12; kata/ tinos LXX Ex. 20.16, Ev.Marc.14.56.

yeudomartu^r-i/a, h(,
false witness, D.41.16 codd.; yeudomarturi/an katagnw=nai/ tinos Is.12.6 codd.: e)n yeudomarturi/ais D.57.53 codd.: but mostly in gen. pl., yeudomarturiw=n dia/krisis Pl. Lg.937b; -iw=n di/kh Is.3.6; kri/seis Arist.Pol.1263b21; -iw=n e(lei=n tina to convict, and a(lw=nai to be convicted, of
perjury, Is.5.15, And. 1.7, Lys.10.25, Aeschin.1.85; o)flei=n And.1.74; -iw=n e)piskh/yasqai/ tini make allegation of
perjury against one, D.29.7; etc. (This form is perh. always corrupt in codd. of classical authors; -i/wn (gen. pl. neut., cf. sq.) shd. prob. be read for -iw=n, and may be restored for -i/an in D.41.16, Is.12.6; so -i/ois for -i/ais in D.57.53: twn yeudomarturiwn is unaccented in Pap. of Hyp.Phil.12: yeudomarturia[n is an uncertain restoration in IG5(2).357.3 (Stymphalus, iii B.C.); but the fem. form existed later, Ev.Matt.15.19, 26.59.)

yeudomartu^r-i/ou di/kh, an action
for false witness or
perjury, Cratin. 454, PHal.1.24, 41,49, al. (iii B.C.); in dat. pl., e)/noxos toi=s yeudomarturi/ois Pl.Tht.148b; acc. pl. ta\ -martu/ria Arist.Ath.59.6.

yeudoma/rtus, u^ros, o(,
false witness, pl. in Gorg.Pal.23, Pl.Grg. 472b, Critias 61: sg., IG5(2).357.4 (Stymphalus, iii B.C.): yeudoma/rtures tou= qeou=
false witnesses about God, 1 Ep.Cor.15.15; as Adj., ta\n di/kan ta\n yeudoma/rtura the action
for false witness, IGl.c. l. 8; y. timai/ honours
attesting no real merit, Plu.2.821f.
yeudo/menos, o(, v. yeu/dw B. IV.

yeudo/nardos, h(,

yeudone/rwn, wnos, o(,
a false Nero, Luc.Ind.20.
yeudo/-nitros, on, Att. yeudo/litros (q. v.).
yeudo-pa^qe/s, to/, = stafi\s a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.4.152.

yeudo-paidei/a, h(,

yeu/do-pan, a_nos, o(,

yeudo-pa/rqenos, h(,
pretended maid or
virgin, Hdt.4.180; as Adj., y. e(tai/ra Ach.Tat.8.3.

floor, Cod.Just.8.10.12.3a.

yeudo-pa/twr [a^], oros, o(,

yeudo/-pi^qos, o(,

yeudo-pla/nhs [a^], htos, o(, and yeudo-pla^nh/ths, ou, o(, prob.
lying vagrant, Eust. 1762.2, 1742.23, of Odysseus.

yeudo-pla/sths, ou, o(,
forger of lies, Sch.Ar.Nu.445.

yeudo/-ploutos, on,
feigned to be rich, Sch.Ar.V.457.

yeudo-poie/w,
misrepresent, ta\ eu)ergeth/mata . . tw=n a)/llwn e)peira=to yeudopoiei=n kai\ tapeinou=n Plb.30.4.13.
give the lie to, expose as false, ta\s a)pofa/seis tw=n poihtw=n Id.12.25.4, cf. 12.25c.3, S.E.M.24; folld. by acc. et inf.,
stigmatize as false the doctrine that . . , Phld.Rh.2.87S. Pass.,
to be deceived or
mistaken, err, ai)/sqhsis -ei=tai Placit.4.9.5.

yeudo-poli/xnion, to/,

yeudo-po/rfu^ron, to/,

yeudo-presbeuth/s, ou=, o(,

yeudo-prodosi/a, h(,
pretended treachery, Polyaen.3.9.32.

yeudo-prodo/ths, ou, o(,
pretended traitor, Id.6.38.7.

yeudo-profh/ths,
ou, o(,
false, lying prophet, J.AJ9.6.6, al., 2 Ep.Pet.2.1, Ph.2.343, etc.

sham or
unfair fall from which one starts up again and renews the contest, Plu.Comp.Pel.Marc. 1, Sch.Ar.Eq.568, Macar.8.88.

yeudo/-ptwxos, o(,

yeudo-rayw|do/s, o(,

yeudork-e/w,
swear falsely, Ar.Ec.603 (anap.); distd. fr. e)piorkei=n by Chrysipp.Stoic.2.63.

yeudork-i/a, h(,
perjury, Ph.2.196.

yeudo/rk-ios, on,
perjured, forsworn, Hdt.1.165.
yeu/dork-os, on, = foreg., E.Med.1392 (anap.), Ps.-Phoc.17: Sup., Ph.1.412.

yeudorrh/mwn, on, gen. onos, ta\ y.
false locutions, perh.
made-up words, Phld.Po.2.41.

yeu=dos, eos, to/, Ep. dat. pl. yeu/dessi, v. yeudh/s 1.2: (yeu/dw):â
falsehood, lie, yeu/dea . . e)tu/moisin o(moi=a Od.19.203, Hes.Th.27; yeu=do/s ken fai=men Il.2.81; yeu=dos d' ou)k e)re/ei Od.3.20; ei)/ te yeu=dos u(po/sxesis ei)/ te kai\ ou)ki/ whether the promise be a
lie or no, Il.2.349; ou)/ti yeu=dos e)ma\s a)/tas kate/lecas 9.115; yeu/dessin qe/lgein tina/ 21.276, cf. 23.576, Od.14.387; ou) yeu/dei+ te/gcw lo/gon Pi.O.4.19; y. poiki/la, ai)o/lon y., Id.O.1.29, N.8.25; y. gluku/ a sweet
deceit, Id.P.2.37; yeu=dos ou)de\n w=(n le/gw S.El.1220; ou)de\n e(/rpei y. ei)s gh=ras xro/nou Id.Fr.62; ei)/ ti yeu=dos ei)/rhka Antipho 3.4.2; y. e)pife/rein Aeschin.3.41: y. le/gein distd. fr. yeu/desqai, Stoic.2.42. in Logic,
false conclusion, fallacy, sullogismo\s tou= yeu/dous Arist.APr.61b3; sumbai/nei y. ib.37a36:âin NT of what is opposed to religious truth,
false doctrine, Ep.Rom.1.25; poiw=n bde/lugma kai\ y., i.e. doing what is repugnant to the true faith, Apoc.21.27; of false anatomical doctrine, to\ oi)/esqai . . y. e)sti Sor.1.17. in Theoc. 12.24 yeu/dea are
spots, pimples on the nose; supposed to be characteristic of liars, cf. Sch. ad loc.; cf. yudra/kion.
white spots on the fingernails, Alex.Aphr.Pr.Anecd.2.58. In Pl. yeu=dos is freq. opp. a)lhqe/s, Grg.505e, R.382d, Euthd.272b, al.; so almost like an Adj. (cf. yeudh/s init.), o)/noma yeu=dos kai\ a)lhqe\s le/gein Cra.385c; para/doco/n te kai\ yeu=dos o)/noma Plt.281b: cf. E.Heracl.462 codd.

yeudo-se/lhnon, to/,
false moonlight, absence of the moon, Hsch., Suid.
yeudo-se/li_non, to/, = pente/fullon, Dsc.4.42.

yeudosof-i/a, h(,
false wisdom, and yeudo/sofos, on,

yeudosof-isth/s, ou=, o(,

yeudostigma^ti/as, ou, o(,
a false or
pretended stigmati/as, name of a play by Nicostr.Com.

yeudo/stom-a, atos, to/,
the false or
blind mouth of a river, Str.17.1.18(pl.).

yeudostom-e/w,

yeudo-suggra^feu/s, e/ws, o(,

yeudo/-sfhc, hkos, o(,

yeudo-ta/fion [a^], to/, = kenota/fion, Philostr.VA8.31.

yeudo-texni/a, h(,

yeudo-triskaide/ka^tos, h, on,

yeudourgo/s, o(,

yeudo-fa^h/s, e/s,

yeudo-fa^nh/s, e/s, = foreg., Placit.2.30.4.

yeudo/-fhmos, on,

yeudofi/lippos [fi^], o(,

yeudo/xristos, o(, in pl.,

yeudo/xru_sos, o(,

yeudo/xru_sos, on,
of mock gold, Plu.2.50a.

yeud-upobolimai=os, a, on,
falsely held to be supposititious; o( *yeudup. name of plays by Crobylus and Cratin.Jun.

yeu/dw, S.Ant.389, etc.: fut. yeu/sw Id.OC628, X.Cyr.1.5.13: aor. e)/yeusa A.Pers.472, Plb.18.11.11, etc.:âPass., fut. yeusqh/somai S.Tr.712, Gal.15.143: aor. e)yeu/sqhn Hdt.1.141, etc.: pf. e)/yeusmai (v. infr.); imper. e)yeu/sqw Aeschin.1.162:â
cheat by lies, beguile, tina S.OC628, etc.:âPass.,
to be cheated, deceived, A.Ch.759, etc.; ei) mh\ polu/ ge e)/yeusmai unless
I am much
deceived, Antipho 3.2.1. c. gen.,
cheat, balk, disappoint one
of a thing, yeu/sei s' o(dou= th=sd' e)lpi/s E.Hec.1031; e)/yeusas frenw=n *pe/rsas A.Pers.472; mh\ yeu=son w=) *zeu= th=s e)piou/shs e)lpi/dos Ar.Th.870; pisteu/w . . mh\ yeu/sein me . . ta\s e)lpi/das X.Cyr.1.5.13; po/ll' e)lpi/des yeu/dousi kai\ lo/goi brotou/s E.Fr. 650:âPass.,
to be cheated balked, disappointed, tinos
of a thing, yeusqh=nai e)lpi/dos, ga/mou, Hdt.1.141, 5.47; e)na/rwn S.Aj.178(lyr.); dei/pnou Ar.Nu.618 (troch.); yeusqe/ntes tw=n skopw=n
disappointed of receiving tidings from the scouts, Th.8.103. in Pass., also,
to be deceived, mistaken in or
about a thing, e)yeusme/noi gnw/mhs
deceived in their judgement,
mistaken in opinion, Hdt.8.40, cf. S.Tr. 712 (also yeusqh=nai gnw/mh| Hdt.7.9.g/ï¼; e)yeusme/noi th=s *)aqhnai/wn duna/mews
deceived or
mistaken in their notions of the Athenian power, Th.4.108; pollw=n e)yeu/sqhte th=s ou)si/as you have often
had a mistaken idea of a man's wealth, Lys.19.45; tou/tou ou)k e)yeu/sqhn Pl.Ap.22d; e)yeu=sqai th=s a)lhqei/as Id.R.413a; th=s w(/ras And.1.38; e)yeusme/noi tw=n o)/ntwn Pl.Tht.195a; e)yeu=sqai e(autw=n, opp. ei)de/nai e(autou/s, X.Mem.4.2.26; also yeusqh=nai e)/n tisi Hdt.9.48; peri/ tinos X.An.2.6.28, Pl.Prt.358c: also c. acc., e)yeu/sqh tou=to X.An.1.8.11, etc.; au)tou\s e)yeusme/nh h( *(ella/s
deceived in its estimate of them, Th.6.17 (where au)tou\s is prob. corrupt, and shd. perh. be omitted): c. acc. cogn., eu)tuxe/staton yeu=sma e)yeusme/nos most happily
deceived or
mistaken, Pl.Men.71d: more rarely in Act., kai/ m' e)/yeusas e)lpi/dos polu/ thou hast much
belied my expectation, i.e. turned out better than I feared, S.Aj.1382. of statements,
to be untrue, h( tri/th tw=n o(dw=n ma/lista e)/yeustai the third mode of explanation
is most
untrue, most
mistaken, Hdt.2.22. c. acc. rei, like yeudopoie/w 11,
represent a thing
as a lie, falsify, yeu/dontes ou)de\n sh=ma tw=n prokeime/nwn S.OC1512 (prob. for shma/twnï¼; yeu/dei h( )pi/noia th\n gnw/mhn afterthought
gives opinion
the lie, Id.Ant.389:â Pass., h)\n ta/de yeusqh=| le/gwn if his word
prove (lit.
be proved) false, Id.Ph.1342; h( yeusqei=sa u(po/sxesis the promise
broken, Th.3.66; pa/nta pro\s u(ma=s e)/yeustai
have been falsely reported, D.52.23; in E.Andr.346 for a)lla\ yeu/setai
it will be falsely said, Porson's correction e)yeu/setai is probable (peu/setai Kiehl). earlier and more common yeu/domai, imper. yeu/deo Il.4.404 (the Act. is very rare in Att. Prose): fut. yeu/somai Hom., Pi., Att.: aor e)yeusa/mhn, v. infr.: fut. 2 e)yeu/somai (
will have made a false statement) Gal.15.137(s. v.l.): pf. e)/yeusmai X.An.1.3.10. abs.,
lie, speak false, play false, yeu/somai h=) e)/tumon e)re/w; Il.10.534, Od.4.140; ou)k oi=)da yeu/desqai h.Merc.369; ou) yeu/som' a)mfi\ *kori/nqw| Pi.O.13.52; peri/ tinos Pl.Prt.347a; y. kata/ tinos, opp. le/gein ta)lhqh= kata/ tinos, Id.Euthd.284a, Lys.22.7; y. pro/s tina X.An.1.3.5; y. tini Act.Ap. 5.4 and ei)/s tina Ep.Col.3.9. c. inf.,
say falsely, pretend that . . , Plu.2.506d. c. acc. rei,
say that which is untrue, whether intentionally or not, tou=to/ g' ou)k e)yeu/sato Ar.Ec.445; ou)de\n au)tw=n yeu/detai Id.Ach.561; ka)\n la/bh|s e)yeusme/non, fa/skein e)/m' h)/dh mantikh=| mhde\n fronei=n S.OT461; e)a/n ti mh\ a)lhqe\s le/gw . . , ei)pe\ o(/ti tou=to yeu/domai: e(kw\n ga\r ei=)nai ou)de\n yeu/somai Pl.Smp.214e, cf. X.Mem.4.2.19; peri\ w=(n e)/yeustai dida/skein u(ma=s Lys.3.21.
to be false or
faithless, to be perjured or
forsworn, Hes.Op.283. o( yeudo/menos, the
Liar, name of a fallacy or logical puzzle invented by Eubulides, a disciple of Euclides of Megara, Thphr. ap. D.L.2.108, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.92 (yeudo/menos is an interpolation in o( sofistiko\s lo/gos y. Arist.EN1146a22). like Act. 11,
belie, falsify, o(/rkia yeu/sasqai
break them, Il.7.352; so sunqh/kas y. X.Ages.1.12; ga/mous E.Ba. 31,245; so in plpf., e)/yeusto th\n cummaxi/an Th.5.83; so also ou)k e)yeu/santo ta\s a)peila/s
they did not
belie, i.e. they made good, their threats, Hdt.6.32; ta\ xrh/mata . . e)yeusme/noi h=)san
had broken their word about the money, X.An.5.6.35. like Act. 1,
deceive by lies, cheat, *aoci/an e)yeusa/mhn A.Ag.1208, cf. X.HG3.1.25; also y. tina/ ti
deceive one
in a thing, S.OC1145, E.Alc.808; a(/per au)to\n ou) yeu/somai and therein I
will not
disappoint him (ironical), i.e. I will carry out my threat, And.1.123; tw=n e)/rgwn w=(n a)\n to\n e)kdo/nta yeu/shtai ï¼w=(n being in gen. by attraction) Pl.Lg.921a. of combinations of words,
make a false statement, Arist.Int.16a3.

yeud-wmo/ths, ou, o(,
false swearer, Lyc.523.

yeud-w/motos, on,
falsely sworn, forsworn, o(/rkos Id.932.

yeud-w/nu^mos, on,
under a false name, falsely called, *(ubristh
 potamo
 ou) yeudw/numon A.Pr. 717; pandi/kws y. Id.Th.670; ou)/noma d' *eu)tuxi/dhs: yeudw/numon a)lla/ me dai/mwn qh=ken a)farpa/cas IG3.1308; y. qeoi/ Ph.2.161, cf. 2.599; y. gnw=sis 1 Ep.Ti.6.21; filo/sofos yeudepi/grafos kai\ y. Plu.2.479e; opp. a)lhqh/s, to\ meristo
 y. Dam.Pr.399. Adv. -mws
by a false name, y. se dai/mones *promhqe/a kalou=sin A.Pr.85, cf. Them.Or.2.30a.

yeusi/stuc, u^gos, o(, h(,
hating falsehood, epith of Apollo, AP9.525.24.

yeu=s-ma, atos, to/,
lie, untruth, fraud, eu)tuxe/staton yeu=sma e)yeusme/nos Pl.Men.71d, cf. Luc.Tim.55, Plu.Art.13. tou\s e)pi\ th=s r(ino\s fuome/nous i)o/nqous *sikeliw=tai yeu/smata e)/legon Sch.Theoc. 12.24, cf. Kaibel CGFp.218.

yeus-ta/cw, = yeu/domai,
lie, Tz.H.9.434.

yeus-te/w,
to be a liar, Il.19.107.
yeus-th/r, h=ros, o(, = sq., Man. 4.119.

yeu/s-ths, ou, o(, (yeu/dw)
liar, cheat, Il.24.261; a)nh\r y. Hdt. 7.209, cf. LXX Si.15.8: c. gen. rei, w=(n . . yeu=stai fanou/meqa wherein we shall be found to be
liars, S.Ant.1195, cf. Arist.EN1127b16, AP12.70 (Mel.), Phld.Herc.1457.12. Adj., = yeudh/s,
lying, false, y. lo/gos Pi.N.5.29; yeu/sths d' ou=(tos e)/pesti li/qos, of a cenotaph, AP7.273 (Leon.); to\n yeu/stan de/ me tu/mbon . . qe/nto: ti/ qau=ma; *krh=tes o(/pou yeu=stai, kai\ *dio/s e)sti ta/fos ib.275 (Gaet.), alluding to *krh=tes a)ei\ yeu=stai, Epimenid. 1, which is cited by Call.Jov.8, Ep.Tit.1.12.

yeus-ti/a, h(, =
fallacia, dub. in Gloss.

yeus-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
mendacious, Vett.Val.17.31.
yeu=stis, idos, h(, fem. of yeu/sths, nu/c Epigr.Gr.418 (Cyrene).
yef-ai/ais: skoteinai=s, and yefai=on: lupro/n, skoteino/n, Hsch.

yef-a^ro/s, a/, o/n,
gloomy, cloudy, Hp. ap. Gal.19.156 (v.l. for u(poy- in Hp.Prorrh.1.116).

ye/f-as, a^os, to/,
gloom, darkness, Pi.Fr.324.

yef-hno/s, h/, o/n,
dark, obscure, metaph. of a person, Pi.N.3.41 codd. (-eino/s Bgk., -enno/s Pors.).
yefoeidh/s, e/s, gloss on yefaro/s, Gal.19.156.

ye/fos, eos, to/,
darkness, cj. Lobeck in Alc.112 (yo/fou, sko/tou codd.), cf. Gal.19.156; = kapno/s, Hsch.
ye/fw, in 3sg. ye/fei: de/doiken, e)ntre/pei, lupei=, fronti/zei, Hsch.: cf. meta-ye/fw; also prob. e)pi/-ssofos.
ye/w, = ya/w, EM818.2. yh=|, v. ya/w.

yh=g-ma, atos, to/, (yh/xw)
that which is rubbed or
scraped off, shavings, scrapings, chips, y. xrusou= gold-
dust, Hdt.4.195; so without xrusou=, Id.1.93, 3.94 sq.; y. xruso/teukton Eub.20; y. a)rgura= Inscr.DÃ©los 442B89 (ii B.C.); purwqe\n y., of dust and ashes, A.Ag.442 (lyr.); of wood, ta\ tw=n ai)gei/rwn y. Philostr.Im.1.11; h(/lwn y., = xalkou= a)/nqos, Dsc.5.77; mh\ dialu/esqai me/xri e)laxi/stou yh/gmatos (of gum)
Id.3.22; of
motes in a sunbeam, Arist.Cael.313a20, cf. 304a21, Plu.2.722a, and v. ti/la 11.
yhg-ma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Inscr.DÃ©los1429B ii 17 (ii B.C.), Placit.1.13.2.
yhkedw/n, o/nos, h(, (ya/w, yh/xw) = koniorto/s, Hsch.

entryFree.sense: filled only level with the brim, i.e. not heaped up (korusto/s), Gloss.

div0.entryFree:
yh/ktr-a, h(, (yh/xw)
curry-comb for horses, S.Fr.475, E.Hipp. 1174, Ar.Fr.62, AP6.233 (Maec.), 246 (Phld. or Marc.Arg.), PSI 4.430.5 (iii B.C.), etc. In Hsch. also yakth/r and (as glosses on cu/straï¼
yhktri/s and yhktri/a (fort. yh/ktria).

yhktr-i/zw,
scrape down, rub down, Sch.E.Hipp.110.
yhktr-i/on, to/, Dim. of yh/ktra, Gloss. (in form yhktrin).

yhla^f-a/w, mostly used in pres.: fut. -h/sw LXXZa.9.13: aor. e)yhla/fhsa ib.Ge.27.22:âPass., fut. yhlafhqh/somai ib. Na.3.1: aor. e)yhlafh/qhn S.E.M.8.108, Plu.2.599c:â
feel or
grope about to find a thing, like a blind man or hoodman-blind, xersi\ yhlafo/wn (Ep.for -a/wn), of the Cyclops when blinded, Od.9.416; yhlafw=n ou)k e)duna/mhn eu(rei=n [to\ i(ma/tion] Ar.Ec.315; yhlafw=ntes . . w(/sper e)n sko/tei Pl.Phd.99b: metaph., y. peri/ tinwn Phld.D.1.14. c. acc. rei,
feel about for, grope or
search after, e)yhlafw=men e)n sko/tw| ta\ pra/gmata Ar.Pax691; ei) . . yhlafh/seian au)to\n (sc. to\n qeo\nï¼ kai\ eu(/roien Act.Ap.17.27.
feel, touch, handle, stroke, Poll.1.183; mh/ pote yhlafh/sh| me o( path/r, of Isaac and Jacob, LXXGe.27.12, cf. Ev.Luc. 24.39; y. kai\ tri/bein toi=s daktu/lois Arist.HA571a33; esp. in Medic., of uterine examination, Hp.Mul.1.40, al.:âPass., w=(n yhlafwme/nwn o( i(/ppos . . h(/detai X.Eq.2.4; [o)/rniqes] th=| xeiri\ yhlafw/menai Arist. HA560a9. metaph.,
test, examine, to\n u=(n Plb.8.29.8; to\n oi)=non Gp.7.5.1; pa=san e)pi/noian Plb.8.16.4; ta\s a)llh/lwn noh/seis oi(=on u(po\ sko/tw| dia\ fwnh=s y. Plu.2.589b; ei)/dwlon [tou= kalou=] diw/kontes kai\ y. ib.766a:âPass., S.E.l.c., ta\ yhlafhqe/nta u(p' *)antio/xou the
attempts made by . . , J.AJ13.9.2.

yhla^f-hte/on,
one must feel, handle, Archig. ap. AÃ«t.6.3.

yhla^f-hth/s, ou=, o(,
one who feels, a searcher, Sch.Opp.H.2.435.

yhla^f-htikw=s, Adv.,
by way of feeling, Eust.1717.16.

yhla^f-hto/s, h/, o/n,
that can be felt, sko/tos LXX.Ex.10.21 (so yhlafh=sai sko/tos ib.Jb.12.25).
yhla^f-i/zw, = yhlafa/w, Anaxil.44.

yhla^f-i/nda^ pai/zein, play
blind-man's-buff, Phryn.PSp.128B (-i/ndra cod.).

yhla^f-w/dhs, es,
like one feeling or
groping in the dark, of the gestures of delirious persons, Hp.Prorrh.1.109.
yh/lhkes: tw=n a)lektruo/nwn oi( noqoge/nnai, Hsch. (yh/likes cod.), Suid.
yhmu/qion, yhmuqio/w, v. yimu/qion, yimuqio/w.

yh/n, o(, gen. yhno/s,
gall-insect, Cynips psenes, which lives in the fruit of the wild fig and male palm, Hdt.1.193, Ar.Av.590 (anap.), Arist.HA557b26, Thphr.HP2.8.1.
fruit of the made palm, Poll.1.244.

yhni/zw, = e)rina/zw, o)lunqa/zw:âhence, sens. obsc., ou)dei\s komh/ths o(/stis ou) yhni/zetai Com.Adesp.12.
to Psenize, alluding to the yh=nes, a Comedy by Magnes so called, Ar.Eq.523 (anap.).

yhno/s, o(, = yedno/s,
bald headed, Semon.40: cf. yano/s: yedno/s, Hsch. (prob. a_ and Dor., Aeol., or Arc.-Cypr.).

yh=cis, ews, h(, (yh/xw)
rubbing down, currying, of horses, X.Eq. 5.3,10.
yh/r, o(, gen. yhro/s, Ion. for ya/r (q. v.).
yhro/s, a/, o/n, = chro/s, Suid.; cf. mes<s>o/yhron, and perh. yaro/s (B).
yhssi/on, to/, Dim. of yh=ssa (v. yh=tta), Zonar.

yh=tta, h(, a kind of
flat-fish, prob.
turbot, Rhombus maximus, Ar. Lys.115,131, Pl.Smp.191d, Antiph.132.7 (anap.), Ath.7.329e, Luc. Pisc.49, Alciphr.1.7; y. xondrofuh/s perh.
a skate, Matro Conv. 27. a nickname for
a glutton, Pl.Com.106. (The form yh=ssa Alex. Trall.1.15, al., Zonar.; yhsi/a (s. v. l.) Suid.ï¼
yhtta/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of yh=tta, Anaxandr.27 (anap., yittadi/ois cod.A.Ath., corr. Lobeck).

yhtto-eidh/s, e/s,
like a flat-fish, Arist.IA714a6.

yhtto/-podes, oi(,
turbot-footed, name of a fabulous people in Luc.VH1.35.

yhfa/s, a/dos, o(,
juggler, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.118, 8(3).110, 8(4).217.
yhfh-fore/w, yhfh-fori/a, later forms of yhfof-.

yhfi/dion, to/,
a little pebble, Iamb.Myst.3.17 (v.l. yhfi/dwn gen. pl.).
yhfi_dofo/ros, on, = yhfofo/ros, Hdt.6.109.

yhfi_dw/dhs, es,
pebbly, stony, gh= Gp.2.6.41, al.

yhf-i/zw, fut. Att. -iw= ï¼e)pi-) Aeschin.2.84: aor. e)yh/fisa Plu.2.141c, (e)pi-) Th.2.24: pf. e)yh/fika ï¼e)p-) X.An.5.6.35, (kat-) D.H.5.8:â Med., v. infr. 11:âPass., v. infr. 111:â
count, reckon, prop.
with pebbles (yh=foi), Plb.5.26.13, AP11.168 (Antiphan.), 171 (Lucill.); y. daktu/lois Plu.l.c. e)a\n yhfi/sh|s to\ e(\n e)n gra/mmasin, i.e. if you
add up the numerical values of the letters in the word e(/n, Theol.Ar. 64. more freq. in Med. yhfi/zomai: fut. Att. yhfiou=mai Ar. V.769, Th.7.48, Pl.Smp.177d, etc. (yhfi/somai is f.l. where found, e.g. in Lys.12.44, 14.47, (kata-) Antipho 1.12, 6.10, (a)po-) ibid.): aor. e)yhfisa/mhn Hdt.5.97, Th.7.48, etc.: pf. e)yh/fismai in med. sense, Ar.V.591 (anap.), Th.1.120, etc.:âprop.,
cast one's vote with a pebble: abs., ei)s u(dri/an y. X.HG1.7.9, cf. Ar.V.755 (anap.): generally,
vote, yh/fw| yhfi/zesqai mh\ feu/gein Hdt.9.55; toi=s no/mois yhfi/sasqai
vote in support of the laws, D.21.188; e)nanti/a y. tini Pl. Smp.177d. c. acc.,
vote for, carry by vote, to\n po/lemon Th.1.86; yhfi/sasqai/ tini to\n plou=n
vote him the voyage, Id.4.29; y. paraskeuh/n Id.6.25, cf. Ar.Lys.951; e)pibolh\n y. Id.V.769; di/khn Is.3.7; a)/deian And.1.12; diadi/kasma y. tini Lys.17.10; klh=ro/n tini y.
to adjudge it to . . , D.43.6: c. dupl. acc., y. tina qeo/n
vote him a god, Plu.2.187e. c. inf.,
vote, resolve to do something, c. inf. pres., y. me/nein Hdt.7.207, cf. 9.55 (supr. cit.); y. ti dra=n A.Ag. 1353: c. inf. aor., y. ne/as a)postei=lai Hdt.5.97, cf. Ar.V.591 (anap.), Pl.Grg.516e: c. inf. fut., y. pa/ntas a)posfa/cein (better a)posfa/cai as cod. P) D.S.12.72: c. acc. et inf.,
vote that . . , y. ta\s sponda\s lelu/sqai Th.1.88; y. w(/ste mh\ i)/swn e(/kaston tugxa/nein X.Cyr.2.2.20: y. o(/pws tis a)/rxoi mo/nos Plu.Pomp.54. y. peri/, u(pe/r tinos, Pl.Demod.382d, Aeschin.1.154. Act. is used in signf.
decide by vote, di/khn kat' a)/llou . . e)yh/fisan S.Aj.449, and is also found in IGRom.4.293a ii 57 (Pergam., ii B.C.); yhfi/zomen is dub. in Hdn.2.3.4 (e)peufhmi/zomen Schwartz):âPass., aor. yhfisqh=nai
be voted, toi=s strathgoi=s ei)/ tou prosde/ointo yhfisqh=nai e)s to\n e)/kploun Th.6.8; to\ yh/fisma e)yhfi/sqh Lys.13.29; ta\ yhfisqe/nta ploi=a X.HG1.2.1: fut., ta\ yhfisqhso/mena Isoc.6.92: pf., e)yhfisme/noi qanei=n
condemned by vote, E.Heracl.141; toi=s i)xquopw/lais e)sti\n e)yhfisme/non . . sth=sai Alex. 56.

yhf-iko/s, h/, o/n,
involving calculations, Vett.Val.191.30, al.

yh/f-i^nos, on, perh.
made of marble, li/qinos h)\ y. muroqh/kh as expl. of a)la/bastron, AB374: a)la/bastron: muroqh/kh li/qos yh/finos, Hsch. (li/qinos h)\ y. Cyr.): a)po\ *(arpokra/tou yhfi/nou from a
marble (statue of) Harpocrates, PMag.Par.1.1074.

yhf-i/s, i=dos (cf. Hdn.Gr.2.186), h(, Dim. of yh=fos,
small pebble, Il.21.260, Lex Solonis ap.Sch.Gen.Il.l.c., Democr.164, Luc.DMar.3.2.
pebble for reckoning, AP11.365 (Agath.).
tessellated work, Chor.p.86B.
gem or
amulet worn in a ring, Long us 4.17, Alex.Trall. 11.1.

yh/f-i^sis, ews, h(,
voting, only in Locr. acc. sg. ya/ficcin [a_], IG9 (1).334.45(Oeanthea, v. B.C.).

yh/f-isma, atos, to/, Dor. ya/figma [ya_] Inscr.Cret.1. v 20 A17 (Arcades, ii B.C.); written [y] a/pigma Supp.Epigr.4.171.53 (Tymnus, v/iv B.C.):â
proposal passed by a majority of votes: esp.
measure passed by a popular assembly, decree, act, A. Supp.601 (pl.), Ar.Ach.536, al.: c. gen. suasoris,
the decree proposed by him, to\ *kannwnou= y. Id.Ec.1090, cf. And.1.27: but to\ *megare/wn y. the
decree concerning them, Th.1.140 (more freq. to\ peri\ *m. y. ib. 139, cf. X.HG2.1.32); also to\ y. to\ dia\ ta\s laikastri/as Ar.Ach. 536; e)ge/neto y. mh\ e)cei=nai . . X.HG2.2.15; y. gra/fein bring in a
decree, Ar.Nu.1429; y. e)piyhfi/zein put
it to the vote, Aeschin.2.84; y. nika=n carry
it, Id.3.68; y. kaqairei=n rescind
it, Th.1.140; e)calei=yai, a)fele/sqai, And.1.76, 2.24: prop. concerned with special circumstances (ou)de\n e)nde/xetai y. ei=)nai kaqo/lou Arist.Pol.1292a37); opp. no/mos (general law, statute), no/mous kai\ yhfi/smata Pl.Tht.173d; o(/tan ta\ y. ku/ria h=)| a)lla\ mh\ o( no/mos Arist.Pol.1292a6; peri\ e)ni/wn a)du/naton qe/sqai no/mon, w(/ste yhfi/smatos dei= Id.EN1137b29; yhfisma/twn ou)d' o(tiou=n diafe/rousin oi( no/moi, a)lla\ new/teroi oi( no/moi, kaq' ou(\s ta\ y. dei= gra/fesqai, tw=n y. au)tw=n D.20.92. generally,
decree, law, qew=n y. palaio/n Emp.115, cf. Ar.V.378 (lyr.), Lexap.And.1.96, LXXEs.3.7, al.

yhfisma^to-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
one who drives a traffic in yhfi/smata, Ar.Av.1037; also yhfisma^to-gra/fos [a^], o(, Arg.Ar.Av.

yhfis-ma^tw/dhs, es,
of the nature of a yh/fisma, Arist.EN1134b24.

yhfis-mo/s, o(,
the use of pebbles (in casting lots), dia\ yhfismou= h(|rhme/nos as gloss on a)po\ tou= kua/mou, Sch.Th.8.69.

yhfis-te/on,
one must calculate, Vett.Val.33.31.

yhfis-th/s, ou=, o(,
calculator, Cat. Cod.Astr.2.178 (pl.).

yhfo-bo/lon, to/,
dice-box, Suid. s.v. ta/bla.

yhfo-eidh/s, e/s,
pebbly, Thphr.Lap.47.

yhfo-qesmi/a, h(,
laying of a mosaic pavement, Inscr. gr. et lat. de la Syrie 1.168 (Nicopolis, ii/iii A.D.).

yhfo-qe/ths, ou, o(,
maker of tessellated pavements, Gloss.; written yhfod[e/]tas in Epigr.Gr.532 (Perinthus):âhence yhfo-qete/w,
make such work, JRS 18.171 (Gerasa), Gloss.; and yhfo-qe/thma, atos, to/,
the work itself, ib.

yhfo-qh/kh, h(,
box for counters or
ballots, Sch.Ar.Th.1040.
yhfo-kle/pths, ou, o(, = yhfopai/kths, Ath.1.19b, cf. Eust.1601.50.

yhfo-logei=on, to/,
account-board, Ar.Fr.348.

yhfo-loge/w, = yhfoqete/w, LXXTo.13.17 (Pass.):âhence yhfo-lo/ghma, atos, to/, Hero
*Stereom. 2.35, Lyd. Mag.3.65 (pl.),
Expl.Arch. de DÃ©los 11.261 (pl.); yhfo-logi/a, h(,
yhfo-loghto/s, o/n, Gloss.

yhfo-logiko/s, h/, o/n,
juggling, Suid., f.l. in EM535.1.

yhfo-lo/gos, on,
playing juggling tricks, juggler, Suid.

yhfo-paikte/w,
play juggling tricks, Artem.3.55. y. to\ di/kaion
juggle away right, Lys.Fr.17.

yhfo-pai/kths, ou, o(, (pai/zw)
one who juggles with pebbles, Eudox.Com.1, S.E.P.2.250.

yhfo-paici/a, h(,
juggling, legerdemain, sleight-of-hand, Gloss.

yhfo-peribombh/tria, h(,
jar of pebbles used as a rattle (?), dub. sens. in Eub.56.

yhfo-poio/s, o/n, (yh=fos 11.5)
making votes or
tampering with them, kle/pths ga\r au)tou= yhfopoio\s eu(re/qhs S.Aj.1135.

yh=fos, Dor. ya=fos, Aeol. ya=fac, h(, gen. pl. yhfa/wn Man.4.448: (ya/w):â
a small round worn stone, pebble, ya=fos e(lissome/na Pi.O. 10(11).9; ou)k a)\n ei)dei/hn le/gein pontia=n ya/fwn a)riqmo/n ib.13.46; yh/fw| mou/nh| diatetrane/eis, opp. mo/gis a)\n li/qw| pai/sas diarrh/ceias, Hdt. 3.12; y. a)/mmou a
grain of sand, LXXSi.18.10.
precious stone, gem, Philostr.VA3.27; esp. worn in a ring, Luc.DMeretr.9. acc. to the various uses made of such pebbles:
pebble used for reckoning, counter, logi/zesqai yh/fois calculate or reckon by
abacus, cipher, Hdt.2.36, etc.: hence to reckon
exactly or
accurately, opp. a)po\ xeiro\s l., Ar.V.656 (anap.); ou) tiqei\s yh/fous D.18.229; e)n yh/fw| le/gein A.Ag.570; e)n yh/fou lo/gw| qe/sqai E.Rh. 309: metaph., tai=s tou= sumfe/rontos yh/fois metrei=n ta\s e)/xqras kai\ ta\s fili/as Plb.2.47.5: hence yh=fos itself for a
cipher, number, po\t a)/rtion (sc. a)riqmo\nï¼ potqe/mein . . ya=fon Epich.170: pl.,
accounts, kaqarai\ y., where there is an exact balance, D.18.227; oi( peri\ ta\s y.
calculators, Alciphr.1.26; yh/fwn a)/peiros Plu.2.812e; daktulikh\ y.
reckoning on the fingers, AP11.290 (Pall.); of astrological
calculations, Vett.Val.10.15, al. in Magic, kate/xwn th\n y. (i. e. the object on which the
number is written) le/ge . . PMag.Par.1.1048, cf. 937.
pebble used for a draughts- or
chess-man, Pl.R.487c; ku/bos e)n paidia=| yh/fwn Plu.2.427f.
pebble used by jugglers, yhfa/wn pai=ktai Man.4.448.
pebble used in divination, h( dia\ yh/fwn mantikh/ Apollod.3.10.2.
cube used in mosaic pavements, Gal.Protr.8.
pebble used in voting, yh/fw| yhfi/zesqai Hdt.9.55; e)a\n mh\ th=| y . . . yhfi/swntai kru/bdhn yhfizo/menoi D.59.89: hence,
the vote itself, yh=fon fe/rein give
one's vote, e)n kardi/a| y. fe/rontes A.Eu.680, cf. And.1.2, D.57.61, etc.; u(pe/r tinos Lycurg.7; peri/ tinos Id.11, etc.; yh/fou fora/ E.Supp.484; yh=fon ti/qesqai, = yhfi/zesqai, Hdt.8.123, cf. 6.57; ei)s teu=xos . . yh/fous e)/qento A.Ag.816; c. inf., Hdt.3.73; y. prosqe/sqai Th.1.40; yh/fw| diairei=n to determine
by vote, A.Eu.630; yh/fw| kri/nein, Th.1.87, etc.; metalabw\n to\ pe/mpton me/ros tw=n y. Pl.Ap.36b, cf. Lex ap.D.21.47: in collect. sense, e)xrh=n . . y. peri\ au)tou= gene/sqai
a vote is taken, Antipho 5.47; h( kaqairou=sa y. Lys.13.37; h( sw/|zousa y. D.19.66; oi(=s a)\n plei/sth ge/nhtai y. a majority
of votes, Pl.Lg.759d: th\n yh=fon e)pa/gein to put
the vote or
question, of the president, Th.1.119, 125; yh=fon dou=nai peri/ tinos IG22.222.24, cf. D.21.188; y. a)nadou\s peri/ tinos App.BC1.100; so y. peri\ h(mw=n u(pe\r a)ndrapodismou= proteqei=san D.19.65; die/nemon (vv. ll. diene/monto, e)/feronï¼ ta\s y. were casting their
votes, Hdt.8.123; u(po\ yh/fou mia=s with one
accord, Ar.Lys.270; y. fanera/ open
voting, y. fanera\n dienegkei=n Th.4.74; th\n y. ou)k ei)s kadi/skous a)lla\ fanera\n e)pi\ ta\s trape/zas ti/qesqai Lys.13.37, cf. Pl.Lg.767d, 855d; opp. y. a)fanh/s
voting by ballot, Aeschin.3.233; kru/bdhn th\n y. fe/rein Arist. Rh.Al.1433a23, cf. 1424b2, Ath.69.1.
that which is carried by vote, a vote, y. katagnw/sews
a vote of condemnation, Th.3.82; yh=fos au)tw=| e)ph=kto peri\ fugh=s
a vote of banishment was moved for against him, X.An.7.7.57, cf. A.Th.198; yh/fw| po/lews gnwsqei=sai Id.Supp.7 (anap.):âhence,
any resolve or
decree, y. tura/nnwn S.Ant.60; liqi/na ya=fos
a decree written on stone, Pi.O.7.87; didoi= ya=fon per' au)ta=s [the oak] gives
judgement of itself, Id.P.4.265; y. flegura\ brotw=n, i. e.
public opinion, Cratin.57 (lyr.); ti/n' a)\n yh=fon qei=o; what
judgment . . ? Pl.Prt.330c, cf. R.450a; h( e)mh\ y. Id.Phlb. 57a. *)aqhna=s y.,
calculus Minervae, prov. phrase to express
acquittal, when the votes were even, Philostr.VS2.3. y. is sts. omitted, ka)\n i)/sai ge/nwntai Ar.Ra.685 (lyr.); pa/sais kratei=n Luc.
Bis Acc.18, cf. 22. *dio\s yh=fos ï¼yh=foi Hsch.), prov. e)pi\ tw=n i(erw=n kai\ a)qi/ktwn, of the scene of contest betw. Athena and Poseidon, Suid., etc. *ko/nnou y.,
negligible quantity, cipher, Ar.V.675 (anap.), cf. *konna=s.
place of voting, tribunal, E.IT945, El. 1263. metaph.,
influence, po/lis mega/lhn y. e)/xousa Lib.Or.18.13.

yhfofor-e/w,
give one's vote, vote, D.H.4.20, Luc.Tim.36, S.E.M.2.40;
determine by vote, o(/stis h(gh/setai Phld.Acad.Ind. p.38M.
elect by vote, nomoqe/tas D.H.10.56:âPass., Id.9.43:âsts. written yhfhf-, v. l. in Id.4.20.

yhfofor-i/a, h(, Dor. ya_fo-,
vote by ballot, Arist.Pol.1268a2; opp. xeirotoni/a, Id.Rh.Al. 1446b22: generally,

judgment, decree, qeou= J.AJ 4.2.4. Astron.,

yhfo/for-os (parox.), on,

adorn with mosaics, to\ qusiasth/rion *)arx. *delt. 12.27 (Lesbos).

yh/f-wn, wnos, o(,

yh/f-wsis, ews, h(, = yhfologi/a, yhfolo/ghma, Gloss.

yhf-wto/s, h/, o/n,

Dritter Bericht No.117 (Tire, i A. D.), Gloss.

yh/xw, Ar.Fr.42, etc.: fut. yh/cw X.Eq.4.4:âPass., aor. e)yh/xqhn ï¼kat-) Nic.Th.53, etc.; pf. e)/yhgmai ï¼kat-) S.Tr.698:â
rub down, curry a horse, Ar. l. c., X.Eq.4.5, 5.1, etc.
stroke, yh/xwn de/rhn me/twpa/ t' E.Hel.1567; farma/kw| e)/yhxen qhro\s ka/rh A.R.4.164.
scratch, dub. in Jul.Caes.310a.
rub down, wear away, y. pe/trhn xro/nos AP7.225:âPass., yh/xetai [ h( pe/tra] dia\ th\n plhgh\n tw=n kuma/twn Arist.Pr.935a13; metaph., of remembrance,
to be worn away, Id.Mem.450b3. metaph.,
scribble, a)/dika bibli/a Call.Fr.86.

yi^a/, h(, = xara/, geloi/asma, pai/gnia, Hsch: hence yi^a/zw, Dor. yia/ddw,

yi^a/zw, (yia/s), = yaka/zw, Hsch.

like rush-mats to expl. formhdo/n, Sch.Th.2.75, Suid.

yi^a^q-i/zomai,

yi^a^/q-ion, to/, Dim. of yi/aqos, Philem.26, interpol. in Dsc.5.88: perh.
rushbasket, yie/qin (sic) ywmi/wn a_ POxy.1923.7 (v/vi A. D.): ta\ ai(rou=n<ta> u(mi=n yia/qia ï¼yai/qia Pap.) ei)s to\n katangismo\n tou= a)/nqrakos PBaden29.7 (v A. D.).

yi^a^qoplo/kos, o(,
a plaiter of mats, PSI10.1132.8 (i A. D.), Greg. Cor.p.551S., Lex.Herodot.ap.Stein Herodotus ii p.458, Suid. s.v. sxoi/nou sumbolei=s: written yaqoplo/kos in Sammelb.5124.332 (Tebtunis, ii A. D.):âalso yi^a^q-poio/s, o(, Gloss.

yi/a^q-os [i^], h( (also o(, read by Callistr. in Ar.Ra.567, cf. Sch. ad loc. (575)), also yi/eqos, Antig.Mir.97, Ostr.Bodl. iii 228 (i A. D.), etc. (condemned by Phryn.281):â
a rush-mat, used for sleeping on, Hesperia 5.382 (Athens, v. B.C.), Ar.Ra.567, Lys.921, Arist.HA559b3, Thphr. HP4.8.4, 9.4.4; e)k th=s au)th=s y. gegonw/s, prov. of persons in like condition,
bedfellow, Com.Adesp.789 (anap. (?)); Dor. pl. acc. yia/qws Ar.Ach.874.
blind, Apollod.Poliorc.169.6. perh.
sack, xo/rtou plh/rhs Sor.1.83; used for carriage of wool or stone, PCair.Zen.430, 518 (iii B. C.).

yia^q-w/dhs, es,
like a mat, Eust. 1344.45, Sch.Ar.Ach.72, etc.
yi/ai: a)lw/pekes, Hsch. (cf. yu/a); also yeiai/: a)lw/pekes, yh=foi, Id. yi^ai/nw, aor. inf. yih=nai: yi/cai, Id., Suid. (ye/cai codd.); cf. siai/nw.

yi^a/s, a/dos, h(, = yaka/s,

yia/w, v. yei/w.
yibdei=: u(popnei=, bdei=, Hsch. yi/gnai, ai(, = tri/xes, Id. yi/des: yia/des, yaka/des, Id.
yi/dion, to/, pl. yi/dia, prob. engraver's error for yi/lia, IG11(2).161B19, 287B21 (Delos, iii B. C.): v. yi/lion.
yi/eqos, v. yi/aqos.
yi/enta and yi/essa, v. yi/hs.

yi/zomai,
weep, a)/ me yisdome/na kateli/mpanen Sapph.Supp.23.2; yizome/nh: klai/ousa, Hsch.; e)/yiden: e)/klausen, Id.; cf. yi/ndesqai.

yi/zw or yi/w: from the former we have fut. yiw= ï¼e)pi-yiei=) Hsch., pf. Pass. e)/yismai (v. infr.): from the latter, aor. e)/yi_sa, fut. Med. yi/somai [i_], v. infr., cf. e)myi/w:â
feed on pap, = ywmi/zw (Eust.1631.43, Phot., etc.), or = poti/zw (Orion Lex.col.168); leukw=| s' e)/yisa ga/lakti (Meineke for e)/yhsa) Euph.92:âMed.,
chew, yi/setai pu/rnon gna/qw| Lyc.639:âPass.,
to be fed, e)c u(me/wn e)yisme/non (sc. bre/fos) AP9.302 (Antip.).
yi/hs: maka/rios, eu)dai/mwn, also yi/essa: eu)dai/mwn, makari/a, and yi/enta: ta\ au)ta/, Hsch. (Ion. forms [yih=s, etc.] from *yih/eis [*yih/ = yia/].ï¼
yiqh/n: th\n a)pw/leian, Id.

yi/qios [i^], a, on, Adj., name of a kind of grape, stafulh/ Dsc. 5.5, cf. Verg.G.2.93, 4.269, Stat.Silv.4.9.38; e)k yiqi/hs e(li/noio Nic. Al.181: hence was made yi/qios oi)=nos Eub.138 (anap.), cf. AnaxandrId.71, Plin.HN14.80:âalso spelt yu/qios, stafula\ y.

yi/qu^r [i^], u^ros, o(, = yi/quros, a form actually found acc. to EM506.31, cf. Sch.Theoc.1.1.
yi^qu/ra [u^], h(, a Libyan (esp. Trog(l)odyte) musical instrument, identified by some with the a)/skaros, Poll.4.60; yiqura=n ma/l' ai)ola=n S.Inach. in PTeb.692 iii 1 (lyr.).

yi^qu^r-i/zw, Dor. yi^qu^r-i/sdw: (yi/quros):â
whisper, Pl.Grg.485e; pro/s tina Id.Euthd.276d, Duris69J.; a)llh/lois Theoc.27.68.
whisper what one dares not speak out, whisper slanders, kata/ tinos Alciphr.3.58, LXXPs.40(41).7; y. kai' diaba/llein Them.Or.21.262c:âPass., to\ yiqurizo/menon o)/noma Plu.Alc.23. metaph. of trees,

rustle), o(po/tan pla/tanos ptele/a| yiquri/zh| Ar. Nu.1008 (anap.); also of swallows,

yi^qu^/r-isma, atos, to/,
whispering, y. to\ nautiko/n AP9.546 (Antiphil.); do/lia y. ib. 3.3 (Inscr.Cyzic.). any

yi^qu^r-ismo/s, o(,

yi_la_gi/a, h(,

yi_la/gna^fos, o(, (yilo/s 11.1b)

of or
for a light-armed soldier: ta\ y., = oi( yiloi/, the

yi/lion, to/, = ye/lion,
armlet, IG11(2).161B26, 162B15, 199B57, 203B82 (Delos, iii B. C.), Inscr.DÃ©los296B37 (iii B. C.); yili/on (sic): . . ye/llion, Hsch.; also yi/llion IG11(2).203A4(iii B. C.): v. yi/dion.

without singing to it, instrumental performer, Chares 4J., cf. Ath.10.452f, Suet.Dom.4; also yi_lo-ki^qa^reu/s, e/ws, o(, CIG2759 (Aphrodisias):âand yi_lo-ki^qa^ristikh/ (sc. te/xnh) h(, = yilh\ kiqa/risis, Philoch. l. c.:âcf. yilo/s IV.3.

to be bald-headed, Diog.Ep.19.

yi_lo/s, h/, o/n, of land,
bare, y. a)/rosis
open cornland, Il.9.580; pedi/on me/ga te kai\ y. Hdt.1.80; o( lo/fos . . dasu\s i)/dh|si/ e)sti, e)ou/shs th=s a)/llhs *libu/hs y. Id.4.175; a)po\ y. th=s gh=s Pl.Criti. 111d, cf. X.An.1.5.5, etc.: in full, [gh=] y. dendre/wn Hdt.4.19,21; a)/dendra kai\ y., of the Alps, Plb.3.55.9; ta\ y. (sc. xwri/a), opp. ta\ u(lw/dh, X.Cyn.5.7; to/poi y. ib.4.6; y. gewrgi/a the tillage of land
for corn and the like, opp. g. pefuteume/nh (the tillage of it
for vines, olives, etc.), Arist.Pol.1258b18, Thphr.CP3.20.1; so gh= y. Eup. 230, D.20.115, Tab.Heracl.1.175, 2.33; e)lai=ai, w(=n nu=n ta\ polla\ e)kke/koptai kai\ h( gh= y. gege/nhtai Lys.7.7. of animals,
stripped of hair or
feathers, smooth (cf. lei=os 1.3), de/rma . . e)la/foio Od.13.437; sa/rc Hp.
AÃ«r.19; h(mi/krairan y. e)/xwn with half the head
shaved, Ar. Th.227; y. gna/qoi ib.583; th\n o)sfu\n komidh=| y. Pherecr.23.4 (anap.); used of dogs
with a short, smooth coat of hair, X.Cyn.3.2; th\n di/poda a)ge/lhn tw=| y. kai\ tw=| pterofuei= te/mnein Pl.Plt.266e; a)/nqrwpos -o/taton kata\ to\ sw=ma tw=n zw/|wn pa/ntwn e)sti/ Arist.GA745b16; so i)=bis y. th\n kefalh/n
without feathers, bald on the head, Hdt.2.76;
hairless, of the foetus of a hare, Id.3.108; y. ta\ peri\ th\n kefalh/n, of the ostrich, Arist.PA697b18. yilai\ *persikai/ Persian
carpets, Callix.2; such a carpet is called yilh/ alone, PSI7.858.2 (iii B. C., pl.), LXXJo.7.21; yilh\ polu/mitos,
Babylonicum, Gloss.; yilh/ =
aulaeum, tapeta, ibid.; cf. yilo/tapis. generally,
bare, uncovered, y. w(s o(ra=| ne/kun, i. e. without any earth over it, S.Ant.426; of a horse which has thrown its rider, AP13.18 (Parmeno). c. gen.,
bare of, separated from, y. sw/matos ou)=sa [h( yuxh/] Pl.Lg.899a; te/xnai y. tw=n pra/cewn Id.Plt.258d; y. o(/plwn Id.Lg.834c; i(ppe/wn X.Cyr.5.3.57; qhri/a memonwme/na kai\ y. tw=n *)indw=n Plb.11.1.12.
stripped of appendages, naked, y. [tro/pis] the
bare keel with the planks torn from it, Od.12.421; y. ma/xairai swords
alone, without other arms, etc., X.Cyr.4.5.58; qa/latta y.
blank sea, Aristid.Or.25(43).50. freq. in Prose, as a military term, of
soldiers without heavy armour, light troops, such as archers and slingers, opp. o(pli=tai, first in Hdt.7.158, al., freq. in Th., e. g. o(pli/zei to\n dh=mon, pro/teron y. o)/nta 3.27, cf. Arr.Tact.3.3; o( y. o(/milos Th.4.125; so yiloi/ or to\ yilo/n, opp. to\ o(plitiko/n, X.HG4.2.17, Arist.Pol.1321a7; yilo/s, opp. w(plisme/nos, S.Aj.1123: coupled with a)/skeuos, Id.OC1029; yilo\s strateu/somai Ar.Th.232; y. du/namis Arist.Pol.1321a13; ai( kou=fai kai\ ai( y. e)rgasi/ai work
that belongs to unarmed soldiers, ib.1321a25; y. xersi\n pro\s kaqwplisme/nous Ael.VH6.2: but y. e)/xwn th\n kefalh/n
bare-headed,
without helmet, X.An.1.8.6; y. i(/ppos a horse
without housings, Id.Eq.7.5:
unarmed, defenceless, S.Ph.953. lo/gos y.
bare language, i. e.
prose, opp. to poetry which is clothed in the garb of metre, Pl.Mx.239c, Phld.Mus.p.97K.; more freq. in pl., y. lo/goi Pl.Lg.669d; opp. ta\ me/tra, Arist.Rh.1404b14,33: but in D.27.54 y. lo/gos is a
mere speech, a speech
unsupported by evidence; and in Pl.Tht.165a yiloi\ lo/goi are
mere forms of argumentation, dialectical abstractions (so yilw=s le/gein speak
nakedly, without alleging proofs, Id.Phdr.262c, cf. Lg.811e); ta\s pra/ceis au)ta\s yila\s fra/zontes Arist.Rh.Al.1438b27. poi/hsis y.
mere poetry,
without music, i. e. Epic poetry, opp. Lyric (h( e)n w)|dh=|), Pl.Phdr.278c; so a)/neu o)rga/nwn y. lo/goi Id.Smp.215c, cf. Arist.Po.1447a29; y. tw=| sto/mati, opp. met' o)rga/nwn, as a kind of mousikh/, Pl.Plt.268b; lu/ras fqo/ggoi . . yiloi\ kai\ a)meikto/teroi th=| fwnh=| Arist.Pr.922a16; h( y. fwnh/ the
ordinary sound of the voice, opp. singing (h( w)|dikh/), D.H. Comp.11. y. mousikh/
instrumental music
unaccompanied by the voice, opp. h( meta\ melw|di/as, Arist.Pol.1339b20; yilw=| me/lei diagwni/zesqai pro\s w)|dh\n kai\ kiqa/ran, of Marsyas, Plu.2.713d, cf. Phld.Mus. p.100K.; so y. kiqa/risis kai\ au)/lhsis Pl.Lg.669e; yilo\s au)lhth/s one who plays
unaccompanied on the flute (cf. yilokiqaristh/s), Phryn. 145.
mere, simple (cf. supr. IV. 1), a)riqmhtikh\ yilh/, opp. geometry and the like , Pl.Plt.299e; u(/dwr y., opp. su\n oi)/nw|, Hp.Int.35; y. a)nai/resis
mere removal, Phld.Sign.12; y. a)/ndres, i. e. men
without women, Antip.Stoic.3.254:âOedipus calls Antigone his yilo\n o)/mma, as being
the one poor eye left him, S.OC866. Adv. yilw=s
merely, only, Plu.Per.15; e(/neka tou= y. ei)pei=n for the purpose of
merely saying, Sch. Il.Oxy.1086.65; y. o)noma/zein call by the
bare name (without epithet), Phld.Vit.p.39J. Gramm. of vowels, y. h)=xos
without the spiritus asper, Demetr.Eloc.73; y. pneu=ma A.D.Adv.148.9, D.T.Supp. 674.15; yilw=s le/gesqai A.D.Pron.57.3. of the letters e and u
written simply, not as ai and oi, which represented the sounds in late Gr., maqo/ntes ta\ dia\ tou= difqo/ggou a_i_ tuxo\n a(/panta, e)dida/xqhmen ta\ a)/lla pa/nta yila\ gra/fesqai Hdn.Epim.162, cf. An.Ox.1.124: hence e)yilo/n as name of the letter e and u)yilo/n as name of u, which are first found in Anon. post Et.Gud.679.6, 678.55, and Chrysoloras: e) yilo/n is f. l. in D.T.631.5: but in pa=sa le/cis a)po\ th=s k_e_ sullabh=s a)rxome/nh dia\ tou= e_ yilou= gra/fetai . . plh\n tou= kai/, ktl. Hdn.Epim.62, e_ y. is not yet merely the name of the letter: for u)yilo/n v. sub u)=, cf. Sch. Heph.p.93C. of mute consonants, the
litterae tenues, p k t, opp. f x q, o(/sai gi/gnontai xwri\s th=s tou= pneu/matos e)kbolh=s Arist. Aud.804b10, cf. D.H.Comp.14, D.T.631.21; yilw=s kalei=n pronounce
with a littera tenuis for an aspirate, e. g., r(a/pus for r(a/fus, a)spa/ragos for a)sfa/ragos, Ath.9.369b, cf. Eust.81.5, Tz.H.11.58.

yi_lo/-ta^pis, idos, h(,

tenuity (cf. yilo/s VI. 2), opp. dasu/ths, Id.Po.1456b32, D.H.Comp.14.
the spiritus lenis, Plb.10.47.10 (pl.).

yi_l-o/w,

bare, ib.4.14.9:âPass.,

a littera tenuis, opp. dasu/nw, Phld.Rh.1.155S., cf. EM780.31 (Pass.), D.T.Supp.675.11, A.D.Synt.39.1, Pron.57.2, Eust.515.38, Tz.H. 11.53.

C.), IG5(1).1390.22 (Andania, i B. C.), POxy.1088.4 (i A. D.), PLond.3.928.21, PMed.Strassb.p.4 (ii A. D.), and as v.l. in Dsc.5.88, etc.; yimmu/qion Jul. l. c., v. l. in GP. yo/g-eios, and neut. pl. yo/geia,

the making of souls, Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.68.

yu_xo-poio/s, o/n,
making souls, xei=res ib.1.49.44, cf. Theol.Ar.34. (yu=xos)
chilling, Vett. Val.6.28.

yu_xo-pompei=on, to/,
a place where departed souls are conjured up, Plu.2.560e.

yu_xo-pompo/s, o(,
conductor or
guide of souls, of Charon, E.Alc.361; of Hermes, D.S.1.96, Plu.2.758b. as Adj., y. duna/meis Porph.Antr.8.

yu_xo-poni/a, h(,
anguish of soul, Heph. Astr.2.28 (pl.).

yu_xo-po/ths, ou, o(,
drinking the life, i. e.
the blood, Hsch. s.v. ei)aropo/ths.
yuxoro/fous: ta\s th\n yuxh\n e)kpinou/sas, Hsch.: cf. yuxorrofe/w.

yu_xorra^g-e/w,
let the soul break loose, i. e.
lie at the last gasp, E.Alc.20, HF324, A.R.2.833, Plu.Crass.27, Hld.9.21.

yu_xorra^g-h/s, e/s,
letting the soul break loose, hence
lying at the last gasp, gunai=kes e)n to/kois yuxorragei=s E.IT1466.

yu_xorra^g-i/a, h(,
death-struggle, Olymp. in Phd.p.142N.

yu_xorrofe/w, (yuxh/)
suck out the life, Phryn.PS p.128B.; cf. yuxoro/fous. (yu=xos)
drink cold water, Pl.Com.259.

yu=xos, eos, to/, (yu/xw 11)
cold, Emp.65.2; opp. qa/lpos, Hp.Aph.3.4; opp. a)le/a, Arist.HA598a1; opp. kau/mata, Id.Mete.362b17; e)n yu/xei in
winter-time, S.Ph.17; e)n tw=| y. kaqhu=don Pl.Smp.220d; y., = r(i=gos, Hermipp.97: pl. yu/xea
frosts, cold weather, Hdt.4.28, 129, 5.10; yu/xh X.Oec.5.4, Cyn.5.9; e)n toi=s sfo/dra y. kai\ e)n tai=s sfo/dra a)le/ais Arist.HA599a19, cf. Mete.379a26; sg., Hp.VM16. once in Hom.,
coolness, yu/xeos i(mei/rwn Od.10.555: metaph., y. e)n do/mois pe/lei A.Ag.971.

yu_xosso/os, on,
saving the soul, AP9.197 (Marin.Neap.), 15.12 (Leo Phil.).

yu_xo-sta^si/a, h(,
weighing of lives: the title of a tragedy of A., in which Thetis and Eos
weighed the lives of Achilles and Memnon against one another, and the latter was found lighter, Plu.2.17a.

yu_xo-sto/los, on,
escorting souls, of Hermes, Tryph.572.

yu_xo-ta^kh/s, e/s,
melting the soul or
heart, sto/matos pro/qura (i. e. xei/lh) AP5.55 (Diosc.); da/krua APl.4.198 (Maec.).

yu_xo-ta^mi/as, ou, o(,
keeper of souls, Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.69.
yu_xo/-trofon, to/, = ke/stron, Dsc. 4.1.

yu_xo-tro/fos, on,
sustaining life or
soul, au)=rai Orph.H.16.3.

yu_xoulk-e/omai,
to be at the last gasp, LXX 3 Ma.5.25.

yu_xoulk-o/s, o/n,
attracting souls, ai(=ma (in Hom.Od.11) Procl.
in R.2.111 K.;
drawing the soul out of the body, r(a/bdos Clearch.ib.2.122K. = e(lci/nh, Ps.-Dsc.4.39.

yu_xofqo/ros, on,
destructive of life, deadly, Orph.H.68.6.
soul-destroying, pa/qh Ph.Fr.103 H., cf. Cod.Just.1.1.5.3.

yu_xo/w, (yuxh/)
give soul to, li/qon APl.4.159; sw=ma Ph.1.33, cf. Nonn.D.25.542; yuxou=n to\n lo/gon, of noh/mata,
animate, make alive, Ph.1.693, cf. Plot.4.4.22, Procl.Inst.196:âPass., Ph.1.263, al., Plot.2.3.9.
give a psychical (opp. physical)
character to physical sensations, Id.4.4.28. (yu=xos) Pass.,
to be made cold, become cold, Hp.Steril.213, f.l. in Plu.2.1052f (yuxo/menon Bernardakis).

yu/xr-a, h(,
cold, Sch. BT Od.5.467.

yuxr-ai/nw,
make cool or
cold, cool, in Pass., Plu.
Fr.inc.149, Alex.Trall.1.14, Procl.in Prm. p.571 S.: metaph., fili/as taxu\ -ainome/nas Id.Par.Ptol.270.

yuxr-antiko/s, h/, o/n,
for cooling, skeu=os -ko/n, i. e. yukth/r, Hdn.Epim.155.

yuxr-a^si/a, h(,
a making cold, Epicur.Ep.2p.49U., Fr.59.

yu/xr-euma, atos, to/,
a frigid discourse, Gal.9.935.

yuxr-eu/omai,
furnish example of bad taste, Hermog.Id.1.6.

yuxr-hla^te/w,

while it is cold, si/dhron . . -h/sas poi/hson daktu/lion PMag.Par.1.2131.

yuxr-h/la^tos, on, (e)lau/nw 111.1)
cold-forged, of iron implements, Plu.2.434a, Asclep. Myrl. ap. Ath.11.501b, Ath.Mech.17.2, Plu.Brut.1: gra/yas yuxrhla/tw (sic) tino\s to\ o)/noma PMag.Par.1.1848.

yuxr-i/a, h(,
chilliness; metaph. of rhetoric,
frigidity, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.50, cf. Plu.Alex. 3.

yuxr-i/zw,
cool, Gal.6.811 (Pass.).

yuxr-isto/s, h/, o/n,
cooled, Gloss.

yuxro-ba^fh/s, e/s,
dipped in cold water, Luc.Lex.5.
imparted by a cold tincture, of colours and scents, y. a)/nqh Thphr.Od. 22.

yuxro-gra^fe/w,
write frigidly, Eust.1207.6.

yuxro-dosi/a, h(,
administration of cooling drinks, Herod.Med. ap. AÃ«t.5.129.

yuxro-do/xos, on,
receiving what is cold, oi)=kos y.
cold-bath room, Luc.Hipp.7.

yuxro-kauth/r, h=ros, o(,
a caustic, Paul.Aeg.6.58, 87.

yuxro-koi/lios, on,
having a cold stomach, (Saturn makes) -i/ous, i. e. he diminishes the innate digestive heat, Ptol. Tetr.151.

yuxro-ko/myeuma, atos, to/,
a frigid conceit, Com.Adesp.1199 (-yw/mata cod. Hsch.).

yuxrolog-i/a, h(,
nonsense, Luc.DMort.16.5, Arr.Epict.4.3.2, Gal.8.589.

yuxro/log-os (parox.), on,
talking nonsense, idiotic, Sch.E.Hec. 356, Hsch.

yuxro-lousi/a, h(,
a bathing in cold water, Hp.Mul.2.110, Thphr. Sud.16: pl., D.C.53.30, Sor.1.56.

yuxro-lou/sion, to/, =
frigidarium, Supp.Epigr.4.241 (Caria).

yuxro-loute/w,

psychroluta Seneca Ep.53.3.

yuxro-loutre/w,

yuxro-mi^gh/s, e/s,

yuxro-mu_qourgi/a, h(,

yuxro-pa^gh/s, v. yuxrostagh/s.

yuxro/omai, Pass.,

yuxro-poio/s, o/n,

yuxro-posi/a, h(,
a drinking of cold water, Aret.SA2.6, Plu.2.692d, etc.: in pl., D.C.53.30.

yuxro-pote/w,
drink cold water, Plu.2.60a, Antyll. ap. Orib.5.2.29.

yuxro-po/ths, ou, o(,
cold-water drinker, Plu.2.690b, cj. for yuxapa/ths in AP12.81 (Mel.).

yu_xro/s, a/, o/n,
cold, xa/laza, nifa/des, xiw/n, Il.15.171, 19.358, 22.152; y. xalko/s (as we say '
cold steel') 5.75: freq. of water, y. u(/dwr Od.9.392, Th.2.49; yuxro/n (without u(/dwr) Thgn.263; lou=ntai yuxrw=| Hdt.2.37; a)nagargari/zesqai yuxrw=| IG42(1).126.30 (Epid., ii A. D.) (but to\ yuxro\n also = yu=xos,
cold, Hdt.1.142); y. w(/ste lou/sasqai X.Mem.3.13.3: of the air, au)/rh y. Od.5.469; ai)qh/r Pi.O.13.88 (s. v. l.); nu/ktes Th.7.87; kuno\s yuxra\ du/sis S.Fr.432.11; y. bi/os life
in the cold, Ar.Pl.263: esp. of dead things, ne/kus (opp. qermo\n ai(=ma) S.OC622; of
cold meats, Alex.173.4, etc.; of a snake, Theoc.15.58: Comp. -o/teros Hdt.2.22, Pl.Phlb.24b: Sup. -o/tatos D.S.1.41. metaph.,
ineffectual, vain, e)pikouri/h y. Hdt.6.108; e)parqei\s yuxrh=| ni/kh| Id.9.49; y. paragka/lisma S.Ant.650; qermh\n e)pi\ yuxroi=si kardi/an e)/xeis a hot spirit in
a cold business, ib.88. of feelings, y. te/ryis, e)lpi/s, E.Alc.353, IA1014. of persons,
cold-hearted, heartless, indifferent, X.Cyr.8.4.22, 23; y. kai\ melagxolikoi/ Arist.MM 1203b1; e)k sida/rou kexa/lkeutai me/lainan kardi/an yuxra=| flogi/ Pi.Fr. 123.5; ou)/te y. ei)= ou)/te zesto/s Apoc.3.15. of
flat, lifeless, insipid productions, to\n *palamh/dhn (the play so named) yuxro\n o)/nt' ai)sxu/netai Ar.Th.848; skw=mma . . sfo/dra y. Eup.244; y. kai\ a)hdh\s [*mou=sa] Pl.Lg.802d; e(/wla kai\ y. D.21.112; pra=gma . . fre/atos . . yuxro/teron *)araro/tos Alex.179, cf. Arist.Rh.1405b34, Demetr.Eloc.114, etc.: hence jokes in Ar.Ach.138-140, Machoap.Ath.13.580a; also of authors themselves, gi/netai yuxro/s D.H.Isoc.3. Adv., o( d' au)= *qe/ognis yuxro\s w)\n yuxrw=s poiei= Ar.Th.170; skw/yanti y. e)pigela/sai to laugh at a
feeble joke, Thphr.Char.2.4; tou\s gou=n yuxrou\s y. le/gousi diale/gesqai Pl.Euthd.284e.
silly, grai+di/ois yuxroi=s o(milou=ntes Jul.Ep.89b. [Written yuxqro/s IG12(5).1104 (Syros, ii A. D.); cf. conversely ma/kra for ma/ktra ï¼yuxro/s orig. 'cooled by blowing' from yu/xw 'blow').]

yuxro/-sarkos, on,
with cold flesh, Hp.Epid.6.4.19.

yuxro-sta^gh/s, e/s,
congealed, w(s a)po\ krusta/llou y. Aret.SD2.7 (-pagh/s Hude, -sta/gdhs codd.).

yuxro/-ths, htos, h(,
coldness, cold, opp. qermo/ths, Hp.VM16, Pl.R.437e; h( tou= perie/xontos y. kai\ stugno/ths Plb.4.21.1: pl. yuxro/thtes
chills, frosts, Plu.2.701b. metaph. of persons,
want of feeling, bad taste, D.18.256:
sluggishness, Plu.Fab.17. of exaggerated, glittering phrases and the like ,
frigidity, Longin.3.4, Agatharch.21, Demetr.Eloc.6, al.

yuxro-u+dri/a, h(,
watering with cold water, Thphr.CP2.14.2.
yuxro-fanta/smata, gloss on yuxrokomyw/mata (sic), Hsch.

yuxro-fo/bos, on,
dreading cold water, Gal.10.627.

yuxro-fo/ron, to/, =
frigidarium, Gloss.: yuxrofo/ros swlh/n a (leaden)
water-pipe, PMag.Lond.121.397: -fo/ron pe/talon lead tablet
made out of a water-pipe, Tab.Defix.Aud.155 A28, B23 (Rome, iv/v A. D.).

yu/xw, Hdt.3.104, etc.: fut. yu/cw Alex.25.10, Arist.PA653b4: aor. e)/yuca Il.20.440, Hp.Flat.7: pf. e)/yu_xa Ps.-Hdn.Gr. in An. Ox.3.256; but e)/yu^xa Choerob. in Theod.2.73 H.:âPass., fut. yuxqh/somai Hp.Acut.ï¼Sp.ï¼15: fut. 2 yu^gh/somai Ev.Matt.24.12 (v.l. yu^xh/somai), Gal.11.388: aor. e)yu/xqhn Hp.Epid.5.19, Pl.Ti.60d, 76c, X.HG7.1.19, cf. a)nayu/xw: aor. 2 e)yu/xhn [u^] Ar.Nu.151, (a)p-) A.Fr.104, Pl.
Phdr..242a; kata-yu^xh=nai Inscr.Magn.103.55 (ii B. C.): later e)yu/ghn Dsc.1.55, Gal.7.748, (dia-) PSI6.603.11 (iii B. C.), cf. Moer.p.421 P.: pf. e)/yugmai Hp.Vict.1.33, Pl.Criti. 120b, Alex.124.15:â
breathe, blow, *)aqh/nh . . h)=ka ma/la yu/casa Il.20.440.
make cool or
cold (not necessarily by blowing), a)piw\n e)pi\ ma=llon yu/xei (sc. o( h(/lios) Hdt.3.104, cf. Hp.VM16 (v.l. for die/yuce); opp. qermai/nw, Pl.Phdr.268b; qermo\n yu/xetai Heraclit. 126; yu=con to\n oi)=non Diph.56, cf. Isoc.15.287:âPass.,
grow cool or
cold, Hdt.4.181, Ar.Nu.151, Pl.Phd.71b, Arist.Pr.931a1; oi)=non . . yuxo/menon e)n tw=| fre/ati Stratt.57; of fire,
to be put out, Pl.Criti.120b:
metaph., yugh/setai h( a)ga/ph
will grow cold, Ev.Matt. l. c.
cool, refresh, qa/lpousa kai\ yu/xousa, of a nurse tending a child, Trad.Adesp. 7.2: intr. in Act.,
seek the cool air, Nic.Th.473, LXX 4 Ki.19.24.
chill, torment, a)mfa/kei ke/ntrw| yu/xein yuxa\n e)ma/n (Meineke cj. yh/xein) A.Pr.693 (lyr.); of death, yu/cei se dai/mwn tw=| peprwme/nw| xro/nw| Alex.25.10; a)para/monoi kai\ yu/xontes ta\s prw/tas pra/ceis Vett.Val.44.28; tou\s ga/mous Id.116.7:âPass., yu/xet' a)mhxani/h| A.R.4.1527. metaph. in Pass.,
to be frigid, Longin.27.1.
dry, make dry, da/krua d' ou) yu/xei gene/ths e)mo/s IG3.1335.13; y. ti pro\s to\n h(/lion LXX Je.8.2:
air, i(ma/tia Arr.Epict.1.18.13:âPass., X.Cyn.5.3; ou(= ta\ su=ka yu/xetai, gloss on trasia/, Phot.: in Hom. generally of
drying in the wind, opp. tersh/menai of
drying in the sun, Sch.Il.11.621. (Fr. signf. I comes yuxh/ perhaps, but v. yuxh/: signf. 11 (and with it yu=xos, yuxro/s, etc.) comes fr. signf. I: also signf. 111 fr. signf. 1.) [u_ always, exc. in aor. 2 Pass., v. Ar.Nu.151.]

yu/x-wsis [u_], ews, h(,
a giving soul or
life to, animating, quickening, Ph.1.15, Theol.Ar.48, M.Ant.12.24:âalso,
the principle of life, Philol. ap. Theol.Ar.55.

yux-wfelh/s, e/s,
profiting the soul or
spirit, Suid.:âSubst. yux-wfe/leia, h(, Id.
yxe/nt, Egyptian word for a royal head-dress, OGI90.44 (Rosetta, ii B. C.).

yw/a, h(,
rottenness, putrid stench, A.R.Fr.5: but yw=a: me/ros peri\ to\n w)=mon, Hdn.Epim.155. ywdare/on: au)xmhro/n, Hsch. (ywrale/on Ruhnk.).
yw=za, h(, apptly. = yw/ra, Eup.191(anap.).

ywqi/on, to/, (yw/w)
small crumb, morsel, Pherecr.81 (acc. to Ath. 14.646c):âalso ywqi/a, h(,
blister on under-surface of loaf, Poll.7.23; hence of coin used in Hades, Pherecr. l. c. (acc. to Poll.9.83).

ywi/+a, h(, = yw/a, Hsch. yw/i+zos: a)/fodos u(gra\ h)\ o)/nqos, duswdi/a, ktl., Id. yw/kths, ou, o(, =
quadratarius, Gloss.
ywkto/s, h/, o/n, (yw/w) dub. in Hsch., ywkto/n: tra/pezan.

ywlh/, Dor. ywla/, h(, prop. fem. of ywlo/s,
membrum virile praeputio retracto, Ar.Lys.143, Av.560 (anap.), Supp.Epigr.3.596 (Panticapaeum, v B. C.).

ywlo/s, o(,
with the prepuce drawn back, Ar.Av.507 (anap.) (ubi v. Sch.), Eq.964, Pl.267, Diph.39.
yw/lwn, wnos, o(, = foreg., Hsch. s.v. po/sqwn.

ywma/rion, to/,
fragment, Zos.Alch.p.221 B.

yw/mhc, hkos, o(,
a grub that eats the roots of corn, Hsch. (pl.). yw=migc: sfh/kwma, Id.

ywm-i/zw, fut. Att. -iw= LXXNu.11.4:â
feed by putting little bits into the mouth, as nurses do to children, Ar.Th.692, Lys.19, Hp.Morb. 4.54; or sick people, Id.Epid.7.3; y. tina/ ti LXX l. c.:âPass., e)pi/stamai ga\r . . , oi(=s ywmi/zetai with what
tit-bits he is fed, Ar.Eq. 715.
give food
by hand, si=ton ou)d' e)a/n tis ywmi/zh| du/nantai katapiei=n Arist.HA592a30;
bestow for food, y. pa/nta ta\ u(pa/rxonta 1 Ep.Cor.13.3.
bait, a)/gkistron PFay.2 iii 14 (Lyr.Adesp.).
ywm-i/on, to/, Dim. of ywmo/s, of a bun for a crocodile, PTeb.33.14 (ii B. C.), cf. D.L.6.37, Ev.Jo.13.26, M.Ant.7.3.

ywm-i/s, i/dos, h(, = ywmi/on,
morsel, Arist.Fr.348.

yw/m-isma, atos, to/,
morsel, Democrat. ap. Arist.Rh. 1407a7, Plu.Rom.2 (pl.), dub. l. in POxy.1088.39.

ywm-ismo/s, o(,
feeding with morsels, Sor.1.115 (pl.).

ywmo/-doulos, o(,
a slave to morsels of food, Hsch. s.v. e)nqesi/doulos.

ywmo-ko/lac, a^kos, o(,
flatterer for morsels of bread, parasite, Ar.Fr.167 (anap.), Philem.8, Sannyr.10:âhence ywmo-kola^keu/w, Philippid.8.

ywmo-ko/la^fos, o(,
one who takes cuffs for the sake of morsels of bread, low parasite, Diph.49.

ywm-o/leqros, o(,
bread-pest, Com. name for a parasite, Suid., Hdn.Epim.203:âalso ywmoleqri/a, h(, Zonar.

ywmo/s, o(, (yw/w)
morsel, bit, y. a)ndro/meoi
gobbets of man's flesh, Od.9.374, cf. Amips.19.2 (anap.), X.Mem.3.14.5, Pericles ap. Arist. Rh.1407a2, Plb.30.26.6; y. a)/rtou LXXJd.19.5, al. (y. alone, Ru.2.14).

yw/r-a, Ion. yw/rh, h(, (ya/w, yw/w)
itch, mange, scurvy, of men and beasts, Hdt.4.90, Pl.Phlb.46a, Hermipp.63.7 (hex.), Phryn.Com.26 (dub.); i(/ppwn Plb.3.88.1; boskhma/twn Thphr.HP9.9.4; tou\s o)fqalmou\s e)n yw/ra| sunexome/nous Phld.Rh.2.143 S.; called by Suid. knhsmonh/ (fr. kna/w to scratch): pl., Pap. in Stud.Ital.12(1935).94 (iii A. D.); yw/ra a)gri/a, of a malignant kind, LXXLe.21.20. metaph., y. peri\ ta\s ai(re/seis Gal.8.148.
a disease of trees, scab, Cladosporium herbarum, esp. of fig-trees, when they are overgrown with moss, Thphr.HP4.14.3, etc.; also of the olive, Hp.Nat.Mul.79, Mul.2.117; cf. leixh/n.
a moth, = fa/laina, Sch.Nic.Th.760.

ywr-agria/w,
have malignant itch, LXXLe.22.22.

ywr-a^le/os, a, on,
itchy, scabby, mangy, zw=|a X.Cyr.1.4.11; bo/es Longus 3.29.
ywr-anqemi/s, i/dos, h(, = libanwti/s, Ps.-Apul.Herb.80.
ywr-a/rios, a, on, = ywrale/os, Gloss.
ywr-a/w, = ywria/w, Pl.Grg.494c: ywra=n *)attikoi/, ywria=n *(/ellhnes prob. in Moer. p.419P.
ywr-i/a_sis, ews, h(, = yw/ra, in pl., Dsc.1.100, 3.5.

ywr-ia/w,
to have the itch, scab, or
mange, Hp.Aph.4.77, Plu.2.126b; y. th\n ku/stin Dsc.3.151, v.l. for ywra/w in Pl.Grg.494c; of dogs, Gp.19.3.2. of trees,
to be scabby, cankered, esp. of the fig, Thphr.CP5.9.10, HP4.14.3, etc.; of ku/minon, ib.8.10.1.

ywr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
belonging to the itch, scab, or
mange, e)canqh/mata Plu.2.671a. ywriko/n, to/ (sc. fa/rmakon, smh=gma),
itch-salve, Dsc.5.99, Orib.14.24.5. ywrika/, ta/ (sc. nosh/mata),
cutaneous complaints, Plu.2.732a.

ywro/s, a/, o/n,
itchy, scabby, mangy, o(plh/ Herod.7.117, cf. Lysim. ap.J.Ap.1.34: generally,
rough, Dsc.5.121. yw=ros: paiderasth/s, Hsch. yw=r' e)/xe *surako/sion is corrupt in Phryn. Com.26.

ywr-ofqalmi/a, h(,
